content:
Posted: March 13, 2016
												Assuming you have the same issues as me, once you get the optimisation/launch issues sorted (yes, not ideal - took me about 45 mins) the game runs really well.When you get into it, it's great fun.Positive:- Limited reversals: brilliant idea- Roster size: *huge*- Match types: lots- Moves: lots- Create a...: extremely in-depth. Haven't explored it much yet, but it looks good- New Day: just because New Day ROCKS.- You can beat up Nikki Bella with a sledgehammer.- Sami Zayn and Kevin Owens are pretty much spot on (they're the first match I played - Sami's entrance is brilliant)Negative:- No four horsewomen: Yes, another person saying it. The three women in the triple threat at 'Mania, and the NXT women's champion aren't included, and won't be included. Community creations may well cover it - but they shouldn't have to. WWE should be embarrassed about this.- Some things are a little outdated. Paige is the NXT women's champion, for example. But I guess, with no Bayley... and Emma isn't Evil Emma.- Amore and Cassady are included, but no Carmella. Same applies to Blake and Murphy - no Alexa. Again, a little bit lacking, considering the depth in other areas.- I tried to play online, but it couldn't find a match. Whether that's the game's fault, or just that no one's online, I don't know. But I couldn't play against anyone. So I have to give it a negative mark.

number of helpful: 79 of 92 people (86%) found this review helpful5 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 10, 2016
												100% better than 2k15, I love the new limited reversal system, it makes the game fun and challenging and it can be turned off if you don't like it. I'm actually able to use strike in this game more than once before it is reversed which is a milestone for me! This is the first WWE video game where I actually have lost a few matches, the previous versions were all way too easy for me even on highest difficulty. The gameplay is very similar to real matches, They finally nailed the realism and pacing. If you are looking for arcade wrestling or No Mercy (or even HCTP), this may not be it for you, but if you want a realistic wrestling game, this is a must have! Some of my matches have been classic back and forth, mutiple finishers, mutiple close pins, just the overall feeling of at any point the momentum can change, and it will, very true to life wrestling. I've laid the smacketh down on AI at times, only for it to come back and beat me. Again, I enjoy the challenge!      I also enjoy the ability to interrupt entrances or if you are the 2nd person coming to the ring, you can "Break Out" and control your own entrance (including attacking the person in the ring before the bell sounds). VERY COOL and much sought after feature for me. Now if we could only get a feature to attack after the match is over...But overall, I highly recommend 2K16 to anyone who enjoyed the previous installments. This may be the best one yet for me. The Roster size alone gives it a few points!Restart steam if you are having issues starting, or choose run as admin on the .exe file of the game, ignore the bad reviews about game not running, it runs perfect for me. No issues whatsoever. If there is some sort of issue affecting a lot of computers, then wait for a patch and actually try patience. My framerate, except for entrances (they are locked at 30fps), is a steady 60fps. Only one time did I notice a drop in fps, one time for a second.Also, a tip for people complaining about targeting, choose manual in the options menu, you'll thank me later. I suggest looking at options for other "issues" as well. Don't like the chain wrestling? Turn it off. Several options and choices to alter gameplay.

content:
Posted: May 27, 2016
												Do you want one of the most accurate simulations of wrestling money can buy?Do you want (mostly) outstanding graphics and smooth gameplay?Do you want a relatively robust amount of unlocks customization options?Do you want a ridiculous (and I mean ridiculous) roster size?Do you want to play a plethora of matches from wrestling history?Do you want a satisfying amount of well-made community content?Do you want to talk about Tyler Breeze? This is the game for you	Are you like me and more or less simply want a career mode akin to the old SvR games, with a never ending cycle, branching paths and voice acting?Do you want a large variety of match types, again akin to the SvR games? Nooooope	Basically If all you want is a great wrestling sim with plenty of unlocks and historical matches, look no further. You will get hours of fun from this game. But if you want a satisfying career mode or unique match types, you will be often frustrated by this game. The career mode is repetetive and dull and you CAN'T use your character in any mode other than career, even after you retire. And beyond 2k showcase, don't expect to see buried alive matches and really any niche match types. 6.5/10 for me, 9/10 if my negatives don't matter to you

												Pros:- You can make Daniel Bryan vs Cesaro vs Rollins vs Cena vs Orton vs Sting 6 man elimination chamber match for Wrestlemania 32 and pretend everything is alright.- Roman looks strong.- My Career mode offers unprecedented realism: regulary put on 5 star matches to get stuck in the midcard.- JBL is on the game's commentary now. Oh wait, that's not a Pros list. This one's on me. My bad.In other news, PC port seems to be somewhat better than 2k15. Except it doesn't launch for some people (upd: I believe these issues have been patched by now). Multiplayer, for the first time in the series history, doesn't lag for me, which is a huge improvement. Customization is improved from 2k15, but still not quite on par with older entries: no custom music, no custom crowd signs for whatever reason. Limited number of reversals appears to be an interesting change, adding a bit of a tactical layer to the matches.This review gets rewritten into something more useful as soon as Neville gets a push. And by that I absolutely mean replacing all the text with New Day gifs.Update: now that Neville is injured, I don't even know, this review got sad.Update: not as sad Wrestlemania 32 booking though.

 Joke Review > MyCareer as heel> 1v1 against Cena> Manager distracts Cena goes face to face> I dropkick him in the back> He falls onto my manager> He gets DQed and I win.10/10"I LOVE IT MAGGLE!" Honest Review I've had fun with the game, even though I still prefer the fast paced nature in the older wwe games this is still a solid wwe game. I mostly just play the MyCareer mode, since it's the main selling point for me in the 2K games, and I'm still playing with a face run and a heel run.Is it fun?At times.Is MyCareer repetitive?Yes it is!How's the creator suite?Meh, not as expansive as 2K14. I enjoy making non-human characters and highly unlikely creatures that happen to wrestle. The good things I can say is the logo uploader, but somehow they make it really complicated to do. Entrance is the best so far, but it still needs more and use the PC to its advantage like custom videos, music and images. How's Online?Laggy, even worse when playing with more than 2 people.How's the roster?The biggest roster in a wwe game to date, but is still missing some great ones. I can name a few of my personal faves that are gone, but the majority of everyone's faves are in it regardless.How's the fighting?It's good if you want a sort of realistic wrestling gameplay, but playing isn't as fun as I had in 2K14. Everything feels too advanced such as the stats, skills, etc. I much prefer the basics and general options when making a character. The reversal meter is the best addition though.Verdict?If you want an online wrestling game to play, don't get it.If you want to make wacky characters, you can, but very limited.If you want a singleplayer experience, absolutely get it.

content:
Posted: June 20, 2016
Recommended (no longer with Caution!) WWE 2K16 is a clear improvement over 2K15. The fighting in this game is some of the most fluid combat in any wrestling game, and the character creator is significantly quicker and smoother than others (at least the two I've played, 2K13 and 2K15). Honestly, I only play wrestling games for its character creator feature. I am a little disappointed that there are fewer customizable features than in 2K13 (where is was easy to create a massive-headed, tiny-limbed monstrosity), but I am willing to sacrifice some creativity for not having to wait 15 seconds for an item to load its preview as I'm scrolling through the menu. EDIT!Initially, when I wrote this review, there were a few issues I had to deal with. I have solved the issues by verifying the game cache. If you are suffering from any of the problems below, try that; It may fix them.But there is a warning; this game crashes very frequently. Currently, I've experienced three consistent crashes:- The game crashes when I attempt to preview a lot of the boots and footwear (the first two boot choices are okay, but the third and the next two rows are volitile).- Previewing any of Mr. Perfect's music, entrance animation, and/or absolutely anything crashes the game.- Starting a career with a created character has crashed the game.After I verified my game cache, the game ran perfectly! So far, this is the best wrestling game on PC! If you're a fan, you'll love this game.

number of helpful: 31 of 37 people (84%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 28, 2016
												This is a bizarre mix of great and awful elements. The Showcase mode is stellar, the editor is remarkably detailed, there is an exceptional amount of content and it all runs beautifully.Unfortunately, this is let down by other aspects of the game. The commentary is so far short of the NBA series as to be embarassing. It's buggy (incorrect lines are often spoken, and sometimes the same line is repeated several times in a row) and there are times when the commentator is clearly reading from a script (particularly Cole). Some lines are recorded at a different volume, and sound like they were literally phoned in.The AI is wonky at best, and when combined with the awkward hit detection and inconsistent ability to interrupt animations, multi-man matches become an absolute trainwreck where AI teammates constantly interfere with each other. Several of the achievements do not trigger properly.Game concepts are explained poorly, no effort is made for a manual or tutorial. Not ideal when the series is new to PC.The career mode is built around grinding; even though this version comes with DLC to at least boost your character (albeit buried away in a menu - I wasted plenty of time before noticing it), it is still a painful slog through match after match against the same opponent - aggravated by the nonsense Authority objectives, some of which are rendered impossible by circumstances out of your control. Oh, and on career mode, it baffles me how an otherwise great-looking game reduced Renee Young to a plastic, Uncanny Valley resident.It's frustrating because this could be a great game, and elements of it are outstanding, but it's just let down by so many needless flaws.Oh, and I didn't miss 2K's continued gouging of Australians, either - a 30% mark-up is a disgrace.

number of helpful: 33 of 41 people (80%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 10, 2016
												As a PC gamer, it's been an incredibly long time since I have played a WWE game. Although I've played just an hour of game play, I will edit the review when more hours have gone into playing it. First off, I'm pretty impressed with the visuals on some of the superstar models, especially Randy Orton, however I do feel there is some inconsistences amongst the models, some looking like they're from the PS3 (Jericho being a prime example of this) and not next gen. The game is not the best optimized, I have a beast of a laptop running games like Witcher 3, The Division, Rise of the Tomb Raider on ultra, hitting 60 fps with WWE2k16 on maximum I'm hitting on average 50, but patches will more than likely fix this in the future, after all it's not even been out a full 24 hours yet. Started the showcase and it's fun living out my childhood memories of Stone Cold. The roster is ridiculous, the amount of superstars to choose from is huge. The Divas however are lacking. It's pretty sad seeing Layla or Cameron in the game and not a single member of the "4 horsewoman". The creation mod looks good and glad they've put back a lot that was meant to be taken out the previous game. I've only briefly touched on the Universe mode, which I have enjoyed so far. Overall I think this is decent game, with future patches having the possibility of making it a really good game, once fps is smoother. It's worth a buy to any wrestling fan.EDITED REVIEWSo after spending more time on the game I feel there are one or two things I should add to my review. I still stand by the showcase being great and is arguably the best feature in this game. Althought the Hall of Fame showcase is not as good as the Stone Cold showcase, it is still good to play classic matches such as Macho Man v my favourite wrestler of all time, Jake "the snake" Roberts. The Universe mode is ok, but I feel it's missing one or two things to make the mode go from ok to great. The Career Mode is enjoyable, it's pretty darn fun using my created superstar in a semi-story mode. The interviews with Renee get repetitive quickly though. There seems to be an odd bug here and there that seems to make the game crash however this has only happened to me once luckly, but I have seen on other reviews/fourms it happens frequently to others.Pros:The showcase modeMy Career ModeThe insanely large roster (including a decent range of NXT stars to pick from and legends)Creation mode is back, bring back things they took out in the previous yearsUniverse mode is enjoyableGame looks good and has the presentation of a TV broadcastCons:The lack of divas (having Layla and Cameron but not any of the 4 horsewoman)Optimization (as mentioned hitting 50fps on max with a machine that smashes the recommended requirements)inconsistences with character modelsThe odd crash (happened once in my game, but seen it happens frequently in others)The ridiculous lip sync and the fact the mouths are so big when speaking, it looks like you can shove Neptune in there.Overall 7.5/10

number of helpful: 58 of 86 people (67%) found this review helpful8 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 12, 2016
												While I'm recommending this game based on what's here, I have to also talk about why I WON'T be buying another WWE game from 2K until they make some changes.First off, the game IS a bit buggy at launch and it may run, or it may not. Every single time you click "Play" it's a toss-up whether or not the game will launch. Once it launches, I'm good with 60 fps at Ultra, but whether or not the game starts up at all is the question. Second, it absolutely ticks me off that we PC users don't get the ability to use custom music. There's no reason the restrictions of the consoles should remain for the PC version. We don't get stuck with the console graphics, but we do get stuck with the console limits on custom music. This is a DEAL BREAKER for me. I make leagues of my own CAWs, and if I can't give them custom music, that's half of the pro wrestling experience completely thrown out the window. Sure, modders will make it possible, but I shouldn't have to mod the game to get what I want out of it when it comes to something as basic and integral as entrance music. It would be NO BIG DEAL for the game to let us point to a folder full of MP3 files, but they're simply not allowing it. That stinks, and it's the big reason why I won't be purchasing 2K17 for PC (or anything else) until I hear that Yukes/2K put the ability to assign custom music to CAWs back into the game. It's ridiculous that I would rather go back and play my league on 2K14 for Xbox 360 because it is technically inferior to 2K16 in terms of customization! Another big problem is the submission mini-game. It just sucks, and the AI almost always has the advantage, it seems. It doesn't even make a lot of sense, and I find myself missing the old submission method. Again, 2K14 is making me happy where 2K16 does not. If only I could get 2K14 on my PC.What 2K16 does have is great animation, excellent graphics, and a more streamlined (though more limited) creation suite. I'm currently debating if these advances are enough to make me keep this game. Frankly, I'm still pretty ticked about the lack of custom music and I've been two seconds away from hitting the "submit" button on a refund. The only thing keeping me interested is the exceptionally nice look to this game. But graphics aren't everything, and while the models all look great, they still don't look photorealistic, and in the end I can probably be happy with my 2K14. So I continue to debate over the value of 2K16 to me. If you're a fan of the WWE and all the "superstars" and "divas" in their roster, then you'll probably love this game. Me? I *really* don't care about the WWE characters and would much rather play my own. When some company makes a game like this that doesn't have any licensed characters and instead lets CAW fans make their own leagues, I'll buy two copies (if it's any good). Sadly, I think the thing that ultimately ruins this series for me is the WWE licensing, which seems to be pretty restrictive when it comes to customizing features. That's all I can conclude, anyway, because there is NO TECHNICAL REASON why WWE 2K16 wouldn't support custom music or other customizing features that are missing. So many names were removed from the announcements, so many clothing pieces, so many types of makeup, face paint, etc. and worst of all, on the PC we STILL have to go through the stupid upload process to get logos and faces into the game. WE'RE ON A PC! Why should I need to send something from my PC, to the web site, then get into the game and download it again when it WAS ON MY PC IN THE FIRST PLACE?! This is just so stupid!Why can't I get a Fire Pro Wrestling game like this one, yet with all FPW's customization? I suspect the glitches and bugs will be squashed and eventually the game will start up when you click "Play" instead of tossing a coin and deciding at that time whether or not you'll get to play. I doubt, however, that 2K gives a crap about patching in custom music.GET IT TOGETHER, 2K.  This is the PC, not a console, and we want CUSTOMIZATION. You won't get another dime out of me until you wake up and support the CAW fans, too. Consider it a thumbs up if you only want to play within the WWE using their characters or characters that fit the really strict creation content (limited names, no music, limited clothing, limited body sizing, etc), but a big thumbs down if you're a CAW fan. They really disappointed me with this one. I'm getting the refund and going back to 2K14 on my 360.UPDATE:  Steam denied my refund request because "play time" was past 2 hours. Unfortunately, much of that time was the game "running" in the background (unbeknownst to me) after it had crashed on start-up. This IS a continuing issue with this game. Feel free to check the discussions and other tech support requests. My actual time in game was no doubt under 2 hours. My time trying to load it, trying to troubleshoot it, and dealing with technical issues was over 2 hours.  I do not think 6 hours of troubleshooting and digging into the game to see what's working and what's not working, and what's missing, is "significant playtime". Anyway, if you're having doubt about the game, get your refund ASAP. Steam doesn't seem to care that the game process continues to run after crashing, or that the game fails to make it clear that they've completely stripped the creation suite, prior to purchase. I feel like I got ripped off by 2K, here. Enjoy your 45 bucks, guys. I'll seriously reconsider purchasing any 2K title after this.

content:
Posted: October 7, 2016
												LOVE IT!I have not owned a WWE game since PS2's Here Comes The Pain. These games have evolved so much, and have addressed a ton of little things that were lacking in the old games. The rosters are huge, and not just limited to the current one. So if you are not a fan of the newer guys, there are a ton of guys from the old school and attitude era. I love that you can create your own TV show, and customize the roster for different shows. I've created a "Legends show" with the roster filled with the old wrestlers. Story mode is an entirely new experience for me, and i think it's awsome. It follows the career of Stone Cold Steve Austin and it has you play a lot of his memorable matches accompanied by old clips. It is really well done.Overall I am very happy to have access to wrestling games once again (They weren't on PC for a really long time). It is everything i wanted from the old games. You are no longer limited to just one finisher for a wrestler or even just one outfit. The customization and amount of content is amazing. I hear players experiences issues. I have encountered some random crashes, and a constant crash during the WWE showcase mode, during Stone Cold vs Shawn Michaels. It crashes every single time after it requires you to irish whip Shawn inside the ring. I just end up beating him without completing the objective and am able to proceed through story mode and finished it without any further incidents.I'd rate it a 8/10. Looking forward to 2K17 and might go back and get 2K15.

number of helpful: 17 of 19 people (89%) found this review helpful4 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 13, 2016
EDIT 03/06/16: The game has been patched and all of the issues I had have been fixed. Now I absolutely recommend this game without hesitation! (Original review)[pastebin.com]Last year we finally got a WWE licensed wrestling game on PC in over a decade, but it was a fairly mediocore game. 2K16 is a huge step up from that - It reintroduces many features that were missing, has a much larger roster and online is greatly improved.In fact this is one of my all time favourite pro wrestling games. If you're a fan of the old school Smackdown or N64 games then beware that this is a much more simulation focused game. It's a lot more slow paced and more unforgiving but that allows for more strategic gameplay. With stamina you can't endlessly run away, and you may have to decide to rest a little following a big move rather than hitting another with no stamina left for a quick pin. There's also limited reversals this time and THANK GOD. FINALLY matches aren't just an endless chain of reversals anymore.If you dislike any of that then everything can be customised; turn off stamina, reversal slots, adjust finisher damage etc. Also this year's game brings back features like Create An Arena and a much improved Create a Wrestler. (You can create females again! Yay!) The roster is massive and includes past and current wrestlers including some from NXT. Entrances are the best I have ever seen and are now completely seemless which allows you to interfere during your opponent's entrance! Awesome!It still suffers from Yearly Franchise Syndromeâ„¢ which includes plenty of minor bugs and glitches and some strange roster ommisions like Sasha Banks and Charlotte even though Blake and Murphy are somehow in the game. And for some reason you can't use your own entrance music even though you could do it in the last gen console games. Commentary is also as bland as ever and feels like it hasn't improved since Smackdown Vs Raw 2006.However it is entirely modabble! There was tons of great mods last year from updating wrestler's attire and entrances to entirely new arenas, and this year is no exception. Check out Smacktalks[smacktalks.org] for tons of great mods including tutorials on how to mod the game to use your own custom entrance music.[smacktalks.org]

content:
Posted: November 4, 2016
												Good game but... the "My Career" title shot system needs to be fixed. Here is what I mean. In order to get a title shot you have to be the #1 thru 3 contender to the title. That is fine. (Even though it is a bit grindy to get enough popularity to move up the ranks). Then, you need to be in a "rivalry" with the current champion. This is the part that is annoying. I ended up winning the title after about a calendar years (about 120 matches - two to three matches a calendar week in game) worth of time climing the rankings and getting my title shot finally. I won the belt and in my first title defense... I had "cut scene magic" occur to take the title from me. (You can't control it, it just happens). First issue - the guy who took the title from me isn't the Champion... It defaults to going back to Seth Rollins for some reason. (The guy who I took it from originally). THEN I tried to get back into a rivalry with Seth Rollins (since I am the #1 contender still) and either A) he didn't wrestle - so I couldn't attack him to force the rivalry, or B) I had to wrestle against him, and no matter how badly I beat him, he was "fine" with it and didn't get angry at my wrestler - so again - no "Rivalry" is initiated. Now I am at the next pay per view - and have another match against Seth Rollins - this makes about 15 matches against Seth Rollins in a row... but NO title shot because I don't have the magic "rivalry" engaged.I am due for at least another 15-20 matches with Seth Rollins (despite winning every one of them) before I can contend for the title shot again.This needs to be fixed. I would recommend NOT buying this game until that feature is fixed, unless you enjoy spending a LOT of time grinding matches against the same opponent over and over.

content:
Posted: March 10, 2016
												WWE 2K16 is awesome, simply awesome as a PC wrestling sim. Runs A LOT better than WWE 2K15, solid 60FPS in game at High settings with 8X MSAA. Gameplay is a little sluggish compared to the previous WWE games, but it helps control the pacing and makes it feel like a true WWE broadcast. Graphics are also improved a lot over 2K15, from the hair not clipping as much, to the sweat effects.Very big roster, it has a Superstar or Diva for everyone . It has the obvious choices like John Cena, Randy Orton, and Stone Cold Steve Austin, but they even added the more obscure Superstars, Divas, and tag teams like Enzo Amore and Big Cass, Alundra Blayze, and Harlem Heat.2K Showcase follows Stone Cold Steve Austin, but I haven't touched it very much as I am not interested in the story, but for what it has it's great.MyCareer is also a major improvement over WWE 2K15. Instead of having you embroiled in meaningless rivalries ("B! Blade! anyone?), you get to pick your path into the WWE and what you want to do with your career. Absolutely amazing, worth the money by itself.I would say if you have the money OR have not played WWE 2K16 on PS4 or Xbox One, definitely pick this up.

content:
Posted: April 1, 2016
												To keep this short and sweet, WWE 2k16 is the wrestling game that fans deserve, it is a massive improvement over 2k15 which lacked so much customization, had a lack luster career mode, terrible soundtrack and the worst matchmaking system of all time in a video game.                   Pros: Game run really well, no crashes for me during my 105 Hour playthrough, and the game ran at a                             constant 60FPS at 1080P (Expect for the entrances which are capped at 30FPS).                             The entrances now don't have a loading screen, it just goes from one entrance to the next straight away                             which adds realism to the game.                            Arnold's T1 Entrance and Overall design is incredible.                            Having the ability to choose what championship you want in to go after in Career Mode, as well                             as choices like joining the Authority or Rebelling against them.                            Soundtrack is so much better this year, and you can also use WWE Entrance Themes from the game for                            Menu music as well.                            Customization: You can create Divas, Arenas, Championships, Shows etc...                            Stone Cold Steve Austin's Showcase Mode is just awesome.                    Cons: Online matchmaking is still terrible and there is no leaderboards at all.                             Renee Young's Career Interview's are repetitive, random at times with no link to your current storyline                           what so ever, and she look's terrible too in the game.                           No choice of Voice in Career Mode, and no Diva's Career Mode.Overall I enjoyed WWE 2K16 way more then 2K15, If you are thinking about picking it up then you will definitely get your money's worth compared to last year, plus you get an extra 6 matches for Macho Man Randy Savage's showcase mode because you get all the game's DLC for free. 2K you are going in the right direction, keep it up.

content:
Posted: August 26, 2016
												This game is an awesome wrestling simulator. I've only played one other wrestling game before this and that was WWE All Stars on the Xbox so when I began playing this I noticed it was completely different and people will eithr love it or hate it. So i'll tell you my experience with this game and you can be the judge whether it's worth a try. Initially my first week with this game was frustrating as I couldn't pick up the controls because there is literally no tutorial in this game; you have to pick it up and learn it for yourself. I found myself looking online to be able to use certain moves and certain grappling techniques. However after spending enough time on this game (as you can see from my hours) I would highly recommend it. After the learning curve I found this game to be extremely enjoyable, granted it can be a pain in theâ™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥at first (have fun mastering the reversals) it is a fun and enjoyable wrestling game. There are 100+ wrestlers to play as (male AND female) and also the option to download custom made wrestlers by the community who didn't make it into the game eg; AJ Styles, CM Punk, Shinsuke Nakamura, Batman (i'm not even kidding)There are five different types of play modes available in this game.Play - Allows you to setup any match and play it in whatever ring with any of the wrestlers eg; Kofi Kingston vs The Rock at Raw with Hell in a Cell. This mode is fun as it allows you to make any match and is quite fun.My Career - Allows you to import a custom made wrestler or make a new one to play your own WWE career (WARNING: MAKE YOUR WRESTLER IN CREATIONS RATHER THAN MAKING IT IN MY CAREER - YOU CAN'T PLAY YOUR WRESTLER OUTSIDE OF MY CAREER IF YOU MAKE IT THERE RATHER THAN IMPORTING IT) This mode although fun at first can become boring and repetitve fast. After completing NXT you have the option for any of the main titles (Titles before the brand split). I found myself facing the same people over and over again which became boring after a while. The Career Mode is extremely basic and is not where this game shines. You can make your own rivalries and create a tag team with another wretler as well as having a manager if that takes your liking. Oh and you can't play as a woman wrestler.Showcase Mode - Basically allows you to play through Stone Cold Steve Austin's career. This mode is fun as it gives you objectives to do during the match (eg; attack opponent by ringside) which allows you to unlock extra characters. (although with the PC version you can just unlock everything anyway) It's fun but nothing i've sunk hours into.Universe Mode - Create your own shows, PPV's, Championships for shows, rivalries, tag teams. All that stuff. It's fun I guess but I often found myself skipping the shows and playing the PPV's only.Online Play - Buggy and laggy as hell - avoid it.As mentioned before you can download your own wrestlers from the creations tab and play as them in the "Play" and "Universe Mode". This is where the game is most fun. Although the game features a lot of wrestlers to play off the bat I enjoy getting the custom ring gear for wrestlers and play as them in the "Play" and "Universe Mode".So if you're willing to learn the controls and want a fun wrestling simulator i'd recommend this game. If you're not willing to spent the time to learn what this game has to offer and want a game you can learn in five minutes then this isn't for you.

number of helpful: 33 of 55 people (60%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 21, 2016
												Short version: This is no different to last year. The only change is now you have a set amount of reversals (that you regain over time) to avoid the ridiculous amont of reversals of yesteryear. Unless you REALLY love Showcase or somehow weren't bored of the Career or Universe mode's repetition, you won't miss this. It's probably better than what THQ would still be producing, but 2K are just like WWE - phoning it in now they have no competition. Why try?Long version:Exactly as I said in my review of last year's game, there are moments of huge potential hidden in here.The movement is so fluid nowadays that things look a notch more realistic (like playing a tag match as The Outsiders, and Hall slips out of a move and pushes the guy in your direction as you run up and deliver Nash's Big Boot finisher, beautiful).The tech is advanced enough to have physics for satisfying impacts on weapons and through tables now too (X-Pac's Super X-Factor onto a ladder or table you conveniently laid below is a bit more satisfying now, but not as much as setting up a table next to a ladder, fighting on top of the ladder, and powerbombing the guy off it in exactly the right place where you laid out the table, which you may or may not have set on fire beforehand.But it still needs a lot of tweaking. They're clearly aiming for the more thought-provoking game we once had around 2007, with stamina and limb damage and how it affected your moves, but they're still not there yet. Even when they do add things, there's no tutorial and no real manual so people are tasked to find out themselves what icons mean or how to do things.Another notable thing is finisher spamming and no-selling. Spamming finishers and kicking out of them has become cool. This has been replicated in the game, and it's just as ridiculous. Your matches can go 10 minutes too long because Rusev kicked out of his 10th F-5. It makes the health bars meaningless.Unfortunately the graphics have always been a generation behind. There's been no major graphical overhaul in this version, it's still cartoony, and the Divas are still creepy as hell and have â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ed up Joker smiles. Funnily enough, Steph finally looks a lot like Steph now - she seems to have a face that's been impossible to recreate in digital form thus far.And how's the commentary? Well Cole, King and JBL are annoying as ever. They're all good guys ('faces') now, so they brown-nose everyone in the ring and spout hyperbole like how Kane and Daniel Bryan was "one of the most famous tag teams in history". They have conversations about the guys in the ring... then repeat THE SAME CONVERSATION a minute later. So kudos to 2K for accurately recreating their horrible, repetitive chatty commentary. Well King, if wishes were fishes...While the roster is large (mainly because of the Austin showcase adding random guys like Savio Vega and Mikey Whipwreck), #GiveDivasAChance didn't reach WWE 2K16 so women didn't get the same treatment. Basically the only women are Trish, Lita and all the usual names. No one new like Sasha Banks, Bayley or Charlotte nor the female legends like Victoria, Molly, Ivory or dare I say Chyna. And for some reason Emma has her cool heel theme but is still dancing like an idiot and her face looks like a puffy kawaii interpretation rather than her actual self. With added sunburn to her face.This year's Showcase has you play through an abridged version of Austin's WWE career (with a few bonus WCW and ECW matches). Haven't you done a bit of that before? Yes! You'll be replaying some of the matches you did in WWE 13's Attitude Era showcase!There's no big extra bonus showcase this time around either, just one where you play one match each as the Hall of Fame class of 2015. Relive those historic and proud moments like when Jake the Snake beat the everlovingâ™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥out of inductee Randy Savage while Miss Elizabeth screamed for him to stop, or the time Alundra Blayze faced Paige at WrestleMania 31, or you can relive Kevin Nash's career- and industry-changing moment when he and Scott Hall... faced Harlem Heat in a tag match.I always enjoyed Showcase mode (and it s predecessor Legends of WrestleMania), but it's not very interactive now. Here's how it goes now:1) You start a match2) 5-minute cutscene of entrances and opening moments of match, very slow-paced.3) Get given an objective as you start the match (e.g. irish whip your opponent, do your finisher, throw them out the ring), this can take anything from 3 seconds to a minute or two.4) Very slow-paced cutscene plays of what happened next in the match, this can be a few minutes, because they've got to show every second! You've now been sat here 10 minutes and only played for 2 of those minutes at most.4b) Sometimes there's a QTE, which means you spend 20 seconds watching the buttons waiting to see which flashes, so now you're not even watching the cutscenes!5) Go back to 3 until match is over.This is combined with the familiar halfâ™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥unemotional commentary from J.R. He and King are slightly more believable, but now just sound mildly interested. I picture them sitting on the sofa, feet up in front of the TV and commentating on the match to each other.My Career mode is where you create a guy and climb the ranks. In the last game it was just a load of meaningless matches, and it's not any different this time around. Again there's huge potential here. When I reached rank #1 for Kevin Owen's NXT title, I made sure my bosses (the game) gave me my shot by taking out Owens. He was having a match, so as he was doing his title pose during his entrance, I appeared into camera shot behind him, the crowd went mental, and I laid him out.When I got promoted to Raw, I needed to fast track myself to the title, so I made a statement by going after the #1 contender for the world title: Brock Lesnar! He was having a match, so as he was doing his little pose during his entance, I appeared into camera shot...Ah, you see where I'm going. That's the problem. You can go after people, make statements, do your thing, but there's only one way to do it, it's the same oldâ™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ and there's no intricate storylines. Just as in Universe Mode, two guys beat each other up each week then have a PPV match. Same every month. Even if something major happens, like joining The Authority, it's like nothing happened, just a random cutscene that played.The unintentional highlight of this mode is the promos, delivered awfully and eerily similar to one of the Family Guy voices. "Nothing but net."Every week you're very awkwardly interviewed by Renee Young. She asks you about a guy, you stare silently at each other for 10 seconds, then you get a choice of reply. A lot of the time these choices are vague, or it's a meaningless choice. You'll randomly turn heel for not trashing your bosses (The Authority) in your first month in the job as an NXT jobber, or you'll pick a harmless looking response and your guy will insult the fans or something.There's nothing sophisticated though. All you're doing is saying if you want to feud with a guy and if you want to be heel or face. Every â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ing week. Then do random matches and see random cutscenes, the same ones you've seen every month.Universe Mode is completely unchanged. It and My Career are pretty much the same now. I've seen a lot of people say they stopped playing Career when they realised it was the same as Universe.On its own as a game it's alright, but this is pretty much exactly the same game as last year, if not worse. I don't feel like I've wasted my time, but it's definitely wasted potential.

number of helpful: 12 of 16 people (75%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: September 10, 2016
This is a strange game for me to review - well outside my wheel-house of usual choices here on Steam, BUT, in my youth I played a-many wrastling games starting with the glorious Nintendo 64. And yeah, I love wrestling games. Passerby's generally get them all wrong - they are in-fact NOT button mashers, but very strategic timed chess-like matches of skill.As soon as I loaded up WWE 2K16, a flood of memories came back - and man this title didn't dissapoint. The tried-and-true formula that is the backbone of nearly all wrestling games is still present, with a few new additions. Some good. Some not so good.I like everything about this title, except maybe I could do without some of the 'mini-game' additions to the fights. These shouldn't even really be called mini-games, but that is what 2K dubbed them. It is just little joystick battles that resolve a grab, etc. I think they are unnecessarily overly complicated, but hey, thats just my opinon.Pros:+Graphics are beautiful+Controller support is great+Comentation is excellent and hasn't gotten old yet+Workshop support, a huge roster of wrestlers, plus a deep create-a-wrestler (standard affair) ensures things don't get stale+Metric tons of modesCons:-I mean it's AAA, so it is expensive and there was originally DLC - what else can I expect, right? I wouldn't recommend paying full price, but I would get it on at least a half-price sale no questions asked-'Mini-games' to resolve parts of the battle are unnecessarily overly complicated IMOIf you are new to this genre, watch some videos or buy an older version first, but if you are familiar, you should own this!Peace,

I loved wrestling games as a kid and I just spent 4 hours making a group of superstars, a couple arenas, nailing their entrances, and getting everything the way I liked it. content:
Posted: March 11, 2016
 WWE 2K16 for PCOne of the best WWE games of all timeAfter putting 50+ hours into this game on the Xbox, I'm going to review the PC version. So I came back to WWE games with 2k15. I enjoyed 2k15 because I didnt realize how good a wrestling game can be.But 2K16 is way better than 15.They improved so many flaws that 2K15 had. Now you can't spam counters anymore, you actually have to think if you want to take the hit, or use up one stock of your counter-meter. The PC performance improved aswell! Positive:   Biggest roster ever. The career mode improved by 100% You can play the best Stone Cold matches in the 2k showcase CAW(Create a wrestler) is great again.  Customizing the entrance can lead to some funny moments. Creation of custom titles. All DLCs included. The gameplay improved overall. A lot of things to unlock. A lot of gamemodes Online and local multiplayer. Upload and download user created wrestlers. Tons of moves Neutral:   Facial animations can look weird. Decent, but not great graphics. Especially the audience. Negative:   Sometimes it takes a long time to start the game.  VERDICT:   WWE 2K16 is an amazing game. If you like wrestling you will love this game.  It improved A LOT after 2K15. My final score is a 85/100 Thanks for reading. Feel free to comment.

content:
Posted: March 12, 2016
												It's better than 2k15 by miles, proving that the last release was probably worth skipping a release to get to this point. Although that's not as big of a compliment as I made it sound, It's a very mixed bag.The customisation options are all back and are utterly outstanding, at the moment the hours of gameplay I've had two matches and spent the rest of it customising and completing the WWE Universe mode to my liking. This is where i have most of my fun, nothing better than being the show runner and having the shows run how i want.The wrestling in the matches i have had are still very poor, messy and so, so glitchy. Little mechanic faults and immersion breaking animation trips. Is the character trying to pick another up but he's slightly out of reach? Watch him slide into place as if on ice... Is a wreslter next to an object or even on top of it? Sit back and watch the animation freak out before either giving up or just ignoring you did any button press. It's the 2016 version, how is it still so bad?The ropes seem to be a bug bear of the character models who spin around near them like they are electric. Getting in and out of the ring is still limited to the middle section or they freak out at lifes hard choice of weather you meant cclimb the turnbuckle, go to the apron or exit entireley, 2K need to have a little button reallocating. Even lifting an opponent from the floor can take some work as the character model struggles to comprehend what it is you've instucted it to do, often just looking down then stepping back.Everything in ring feels slower, not in a pacing way just a doddering way to keep the gameplay more 'realistic'. Sure it's realistic if you want to watch the Old age pensioner divison. Running around makes it seem like the players swapped their kneecaps for sponges and they are wearing moon boots. It's one of the ugliest movement animations I've seen in a game aiming for realisim. It's ugly, janky and cheap looking and pretty embarrasing, it's WWE it's already hard to explain to the missus why i still buy the games and still watch it... I've sweated with anger when the prompts of 'too fast' and 'too slow' pop on screen after reversing, I've sat emulating a Rocky montage trying to train my fingers to hit it right. I;'m convinced there is no real pattern, it's just what ever the game needs it to be at that moment.They've capped the amount of reversals you can do at once, which is a nice feature though i feel they would of been better served actually having to play the game once they release is so they can see just how pants the system is and always has been.It's 2016, as I'm reminded by said missus who once again asks why I like this soap opera... Why, why in the day sof 'Realistic action' can't i stop a taunt? Some of these dudes have entire dance routines as taunts which lead to your character helplessly doing the funky shuffle while a large fighter barrels towards you. In short the wrestling aspect of this game is it's worst feature, it's poor mechanics hindered by worse colision detection, AI and movement. 2K definately have not figured out how to do this type of action.Slightly less poo yet still on the scale of "ew what's on my shoe" it's the 'Showcase'. Which is still pretty much the laziest, most uninspired useless game mode. "Hey, remember all those great memories of when WWE was good? Here, play this and remind yourself why you didn't just subscribe to the Network instead" QTE moments which are epicly pointless, the QTE is not so much a 'Quick Time Event' but a 'watch this clip and press the button after a few minutes of an animation playing out' And you can't enjoy the animation of an event being recreated because have to focus on the button wheel at the bottom of the screen to catch the QTE. So what's the point?I know what they are doing, they want us to go back into our memories of when the product didn't feature Roman Reigns, and by having it fleshed out so poorly it will trick us into thinking we were just remembering it wrong and it did all suck. How many objectives per Showcase match do we have to meet? It's like a job i didn't apply for. 7 for the Bret Hart match alone, and some of the descriptions for the objectives are hilariously appauling.The roster is the biggest we've seen yet the oddest ommisions are glaring, the womens division gets clearly the worst treatment as the best names get dropped in favour of 2 types of sting and 4 Triple H's. He's definately going over.Customisation is amazing, the graphics are good for most of the character models although 2K still can't figure out long hair. However the actual wrestling is disgusting by and large.Here's a quote for the next poster, slap it right on Goldbergs forehead 'Best bought on sale'

Purchase at your own risk, it's not a very great port.

content:
Posted: April 1
												Review is specifically on the MyCareer part of the game.Cons- Not allowed to hold multiple titles (singles/tag-team) at the same time.- Sluggish mechanics. (not a stamina issue) Control pathing from running to picking up grounded opponents can sometimes get caught by the environment. Inability to get out of the ring while the player is near the turnbuckles etc. Problematic controling due to simplistic nature of the game's intended layout.   - Unresponsive controls. (again, not a stamina issue) Submission, chain wrestling minigame mechanics are sloppy, and slippery. Pressing a button a second too fast causes the action not to register at all. This happens during striking, grappling, and reversals. - Match rating system is a poor attempt at prolonging matches. Game only registers one grappling, striking, and running move per match. Players will have to utilize about 3-4 signature and finishing moves to gain a five star match rating. 6-8 special moves per match counteracts the game's intentions to make the game realistic.- MyCareer match booking system will often pit the same wrestlers against players even when no rivarly is in place.- Rivarly system feels stale at times. Not varied enough to provide storyline tension.- No create-a-move option- No mycareer rematch option. - Manager relationship system not explained. Pros- Decent variety of wrestling moves to choose from. This should always be improved. Score: 4/10Wait a couple years before buying another 2K wrestling game. 2K Games needs to refine their mechanics. Too many unexplained features ruin the gaming experience.

content:
Posted: June 3, 2016
												When I was a little kid, I would always look forward to the new WWE game. Whenever Christmastime would roll around, my grandma would let me open one gift before Christmas, and it was always my wrestling game. I've stuck with the brand since at least 2000, playing all the WWE games for Playstation 1, Nintendo Gamecube, XBOX Original, nearly all of the earlier generation consoles.Now, as an adult, I couldn't be more disappointed in these games. Character creation, my favorite feature, I used to be able to fill up all the character slots with creations, has simply been flushed down the toilet like a dead goldfish, with no hope of ever coming back or being great again. I've had better load times on the old  Smackdown vs. Raw  series for Playstation 2, this game refuses to let me preview what clothing and hairstyles look like on my superstar because it's too much trouble to render.I don't want to get into this. The old games were just so much better. This game isn't worth the $20 sale I bought it for. 2K is a disgrace on the entire WWE/WWF videogame chronology, my childhood memories, and my grandmother.

content:
Posted: September 2, 2016
												It has a huge ammount of content including a lot of great video from various iconic 'superstars', their career highlights, and their rivalries. The graphics are pretty decent. The big issue with this game is that the control system is simply awful and makes it nigh-on unplayable. The use of right stick in circular movements to sustain or progress grapples is unresponsive and just doesn't work well. The old system of button combinations may well have resulted in repettitive moves and easy finishers but at least it was playable. This, at least after an hour or so of continuous play, is not. Even diehard fans should avoid this unless they can pick it up for next to nothing in a sale or bundle. I wanted to like it and I'll give it a better shot but right now I'm just extremely disappointed. If you chance it the odds are that you will be shouting more than you fair share of Steve Austin "what?" in pure frustration. For once the bulk of negative reviews seem to be accurate.*edit* perseverance unmasks an okay game. I'd still leave it to big wrestling fans only.

												this game is a mixed bag. there's plenty of good like the customization and the match pacing but there are sevewral iussues. the first of these is both the ebst and worst aspect. of the game. the arenas look great, usually the character models look pretty solid, and the lighting is fantastic, but there's also the bad about the graphics like renee young's shark face and the disparity in quality between character models. john cena looks photorealistic while kevin owens looks like the console port of the sims 2 level of bad. the second prominent issue is the audio, it all feels like it was recorded ina dusty janitors closet, quite frankly. the audio isnt just bad in the deliveries of lines or the overall quality, it's also the lines themselves. i know it's hard to replicate live, genuine commentary on a game but jbl and lawler will go on about cena learning kantonese, like who actually cares? it's better than earlier years, however. you'd have a royal rumble where kane and let's say rey msyterio were in there and theyd blab about randy orton anyways i'm off topic tl;dr the commentary is still a hot steaming pile. the third and final (i'm too lazy to list any more) issue is that career mode is still a chore. you'd expect it to be like a decent narrative but it boils down to a neutered universe mode. i could go on but you get the point. ps: if you like dramatic 2 counts, you'll love the nxt portion.now onto some fo the goodthe first apparent plus to the game are the graphics even if they're also the weakest part in some areas. i mean the characters may not all look perfect but they atleast resemble their real life counterparts, which has honestly been an issue since svr 2011. barring renee yong and kevin owens the roster just looks nice.another positive is the vast customization. i'm pretty sure i spent more time customizing than playing the game. you can edit everything from what stable a character is in to what tatoos they have on theirâ™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ this is amplified by the gargantuan roster in the game, although it'd be better if half the roster wasn't taken up by OL STONE COLD.the last of the positives i care enough to mention is the realism. nothing quite accurately represents wwe's modern product quite like having roman reignsa take 17  finishers to the face to win off a spearoverall: pretty good gam buy it on a sale or something if you really like fighting tyler breeze

I never really intended to play this, and then got kind of addicted to it,,,There is absolutely loads to do - any number of match types, a ton of wrestlers, career mode and so on. That alone is enough for me to give the thumbs-up, but it's not without its issues - gameplay is a bit stiff, the commentary desperately needs more variety (and to actually pay attention to what's happening on screen!), and career mode is, sadly, a bit of a grind. As someone who doesn't normally play games like this, maybe I have unrealistic expectations, but it all felt a bit 'samey' after a while. Also, if they really want to get on side with me, make the women's stuff equal to the men's!! I want to create an awesome female wrestler who I can own a Royal Rumble with!Nevertheless, watching Sting suplex the living daylights out of...Sting (because some of the wrestlers have multiple versions) amused me enormously.It is worth getting on sale (I think I only paid about Â£8) if you are not a huge wrestling fan. If you are a huge wrestling fan, probably worth the asking price.

content:
Posted: March 11, 2016
												Pluses+Animations added to make it feel more authentic, IE: surprised animation after hard kickouts, grapple and can push to the ropes and decide to give a clean break or give a dirty strike, certain animations added like sitting upright after escaping a pin to setup for the next move you can do if you'd like strike to the back. Little things like that to add a better flow.+Limited reversals improves the incredibly easy difficulty level of last year (though it still regenerates faster than I'd like)+Career mode post interview after matches adds a lot of life+Graphics and roster continue to get better. Sure is a lifetime away from the 2k14 graphics engine now.+Pretty good customizatin suiteNeutral/ Showcase mode is not as exciting because it's only Austin and a couple matches for hall of famers. Last year they had a better idea with it. But I can't put this under the minus section because it is technically still good./ Changed mini games, I could see hating the new submission system, I'm ok with it. I'm also ok with the new pinning.Minuses-CRASHING ISSUES - this is bad enough to warrant a non recommendation but luckily it's happened very rarely for me and only with entrances. I suspect an issue they'll fix, but even so I can understand this causing you to think twice about getting it now.-Online improved but still takes time to find matches and can have a lot of lag. For twitch reactions like reversal and fighting games in general where you're paying attention to the frame this can be really rough.- One thing about the pinning I would qualify as a negative is they still haven't gotten it to a point where doing things like multiple match ending moves don't end matches and that's partly due to the kick outs not getting harder sooner-Commentary is still garbage-Misc audio like strikes and throws into barriers still the same archaic sounds from years ago-Career and universe mode aren't very different from the past year, they could still use more branching storyline optionsSome improvements, some is the same crap. The technical issues still make me consider giving it a thumbs down, but I'm enough of a fan and enjoy it enough to push through. If you're not maybe this isn't for you right now. Otherwise I am having a good time.

Product received for free
												It's not the best WWE game, but I've certainly been having fun with it. I enjoy the touches to the A.I of the make it so that Heel characters will actually get frustrated and sometimes just start leaving and let themselves get counted out or they'll go out and get a weapon and try to get themselves disqualified. I appreciate the physics they have implemented to objects even if they end up looking goofy. As for gameplay, it hasn't really changed that much aside from a couple of mechanics like the submission mini-game or the visual indicators for how to kick out of a pinfall. The last game I played before this one was WWE 2K14 and i'm surprised to see just how similiarly this game plays to that one. So, if you've played any of the recent WWE games then you'll have a pretty good idea of how to play this game. If you can get it while it's on sale (my friend bought himself a copy and another copy for me as a gift for a grand total of $30) then I def reccommend, it's worth a pretty good time.

content:
Posted: December 11, 2016
												What a miserable experience. The quicktime-event based wrestling becomes boring very quickly, and the frustrating aspect of trying to switch between the handful of "minigames" that every move requires you to perform just to succeed at a move doesn't help. Ultimately the game feels extremely unresponsive (compared to the classics on PS2 and N64) where it was all about fun and not about slow-paced "realism".The customization is the best part of this game, have fun making a character and then prepare to sluggishly stumble around a ring until an opponent hits you and then you just sit there waiting for them to stop slowly slapping you and putting you in pins and submissions so you can actually play the game a little. It's kind of like a WWE-watching simulator, you spend 95% of the game just watching the character you make either try to catch their breath or just lying on the ground while you wait for him to maybe stand up at some point.

												WWE2K16 is a massive improvement over the last year title.Game works better, unlike last year I did not need to mess with settings much to make everything run smooth.It has way more content (all the dlc`s on day one) and things for community to create. Create a Diva is back baby!The AI is way more fast and aggressive thanks to this matches feel more real.The animations are little better and the guys move really good and realistic.The new limited reversal system is a welcome change (no more reversals spamming).New circle submission system is challenging and I prefer it over the constant button smash.Sadly the graphics are stuck in the same place. The game does look good but we still far behind EA sport game as far as characters look.I also miss some excellent songs from the last year WWE game.I was coming to this game with high expectations, bought it on the launch day and I'm not disappointed. This feels like real matches, wrestlers moves like they should - good job 2k!

content:
Posted: March 25, 2016
												Hell yes, I recommend WWE 2K16.  The only thing better than a good wrestling match is a good wrestling game, and 2K16 is such.  My biggest gripe is no mixed matches.I wasn't expecting to enjoy this as much as I have.  I thought at best, it'd be a fun little game to spend a few hours in.  I've put in more consecutive time here than I have Fallout 4.  At the time of writing this, I am still not burned out on it.PRO's:+Graphics are mostly terrific.  Some Superstars/Divas are spot on.  Others don't seem to have had as much attention to detail put into them (not that they're ugly, just that they aren't as good as the really good ones).  +Create modes. Holy isht, create modes.  Create Superstars, Divas, Entrances, Arenas, Shows, Titles... the CAW was always the draw to these games, and it has been greatly expanded upon here.  Face uploads make for creating anyone you can imagine without much effort, and with logo/texture uploads, you're really only limited by your imagination.+Sharing these creations is so easy now.  If you've used the Community Creations of The Sims 4, you'll feel right at home here.  Anything you create (even move-sets) can be uploaded and easily downloaded.  WWF CAW vets will appreciate this - no more writing down CAW parts!  Just share that sucker!+Match types.  Plenty of must-have matches have made a return.  TLC, Elimination Chamber, Hell in a Cell, Steel Cage, Royal Rumble, Last Man Standing, Submission, Battle Royal.  That's not to say they're perfect, which I'll get into in the Con's.+The Roster.  Largest roster to date in any WWE game, and arguably the best.  It reaches back into WWE history and presents dozens of favorites and familiars.  Some of these even have alternate attires or versions.  Add CAW's to the list, and you're looking at 200+ fighters.  <-Holy Strawberries, Batman, is that a jam!+Mechanics.  I spent time playing No Mercy and Day of Reckoning waiting for this release, and I wasn't sure how I'd feel about the leap from arcade to simulation.  It's not as bad as people say it is, and I usually hate QTE-type things, but I find them enjoyable here.  It's nice to have control over how you place and evade grapples/holds, and I feel missing the kick out of a pin because of poor timing adds to that "Oh, come on WWE, how could that happen?" feel you get watching the actual program sometimes.  And like No Mercy, the grapple system is multi-layered.  If you've played No Mercy, you know what I'm talking about.  It literally feels like they mashed No Mercy, Day of Reckoning, and Here Comes the Pain into one big, beautiful baby.+Customization.  This is the best part of the game.  In Universe mode, you can control who's in what show, who they face, and who their rivals are.  It's like a very hands-on Exhibition mode.  Outside of Universe, you can control how the game plays by toning down (or pumping up) the new simulation systems.  You can control what music plays in the main menu.  You can even tweak the individual Superstar/Diva stats, both in Exhibition and in Universe. CON's:-Some matches are not included as team sets.  For instance, I haven't seen any tag team TLC's.  Such a shame, as tag-team TLC was usually among me and mine's favorite match types.  It's a bit odd see it in singles, but not to see the beloved team version.  -Royal Rumble is gender-restricted.  2K16 does not feature a Diva Royal Rumble.  Surely there are enough Divas in the vanilla version to do a 10-woman rumble, but adding CAD's to it, and I see no reason the women couldn't have one.  At least they can do the other matches.-No mixed matches.  I get it, I understand it, there is nothing that can be said I haven't seen/heard on the issue.  I do not want to be a man hitting a woman.  I want to be a woman hitting a man.  Specifically, Stephanie McMahon.   Beating Brock Lesner.  What's your problem?  The point of WWE video games is to create (or re-create) your dream matches with your favorite WWE characters, and Stephanie McMahon happens to be my favorite.  I can set males to be her enemies, but nothing ever comes of it.  We have Super Mario CAW's fighting Freddy Krueger CAW's.  It's not practical, it's not probable, it certainly isn't representative of WWE, but damn, is it enjoyable.  That's what made the classic games so great - you could have your serious recreations, or you could have totally insane stuff... or, you could be like me, and just want to have your favorite/created Diva be the face of your WWE game.  To ignore mixed matches does very little to protect women... in fact, it makes them appear more fragile.  Not including mixed matches as a possiblity speaks to the WWE's confidence in their current Diva's - both that their personalities are not strong enough to clash with their male counterparts in a digital space, and that their fanbase isn't large enough to want to do so.  Add to the fact that I have to hear Jerry "The King" Lawler spew his sexist comments during a Diva's match ("I may be too old for her, but she certainly isn't too young for me...") as a ring-side announcer, and I roll my eyes at the "respect women" excuse for no mixed matches.  I hate to make this such a political statement when I'm not really seeking equality on a grand scale, just a better game.  Ah, well, hopefully mods will fix this.-Universe can be redundant.  I'm okay with this, but I list it for those that may be curious.  I figure, Exhibition will be redundant eventually.  At least with Universe, there's a chance of seeing some good random match-ups.-Lack of notable faces.  No Charlotte Flair, no Dudley Boyz, no Sasha Banks, no Alberto Del Rio (so, no official League of Nations team).  Easily remedied through creation mode, but the over abundance of Triple H's and Undertakers makes you kinda wish these stars were included instead.-Undertaker from his Fred Durst years is the strongest 'Taker without tweaking him yourself.All in all, this is a terrific game, and you can make any Superstar/Diva you want the center of your Universe, albeit with a few warts.  It's been a good minute since I've felt this freedom in a WWE game (pre-SvR and DoR titles), and I've never felt it to the extent I have in 2K16.  Couple this with the gameplay, and I can see myself playing this for years to come... unless 2K17 greatly expands on it (fingers crossed... 2K15->2K16 was a considerable leap).

Posted: September 28, 2016
												WWE 2K16 is way more better than 2K15, i was dissappointed by 2K15 but 2K16 is really awesome.I will list out the good things added / removed and the bad ones:Pros:Huge Roster including lots of NXT & newly promoted superstars.Okay Divas Roster with awesome DLC that adds Lita & Trish StratusThe limited reversals system is actually cool, i liked it, but if you dislike it, it can be turned off.Even more match types. More match types like steel cages for tag team & triple threats, Ladder, Hell in a cell matches for triple threat & Fatal 4 Way.Improved reversals animationsMomentum reduces when illegal men in a tag team do mischiefs so thats good.CREATE A DIVA : We needed this feature.Creation Suite, now with the face texture, there is a 100x variety to create a superstar/divaCreate a Arena, Championship, Show (FEATURE NOT IN 2K15Way better online matchmaking system than the 2K15 oneSteve Austin's ShowcaseDLC Superstars like Samoa Joe, Blake & Murphy, etc.Finn Balor & Demon KingWay better Career, choose what title you want to fight forA NEW REFEREEE YAYNew abilities like Dirty Pin, Rope Break & ResilencyThe new submission system, Yes many people might dislike it even i did for the first 60 hours or so trying to figure out how it works but this system is really innovative than the older button mashing. It does needs tweaks to balance out in the future games because at the moment its easier for the defender to save himself.cons:Cant see CenaNo CM Punk (Thank god move set exists)My Universe has no updates, still the same.My Career gets boring and repetitive after a while.My Career - Champions never change by itself, no simulation at all.Online matchmaking is nice but connections still terrible.The kick out gauge synced with the counts (I personally didnt like this)Only One showcase on Austin which is disappointing compared to 2K15's Five different Showcases****BIG CON******XBOX CONTROLLER NO COLORFULL BUTTONS ON SCREEN***SO overall Its WAY WAY better than 2K15, also its price is lower than 2K15 (atleast in my country)RECOMMENDED GO GET IT if WWE Fan.

content:
Posted: March 20, 2016
												Having spent around 30 hours on the game before this review I can say I've explored most of the game features now. Without a doubt this is a big leap forward on last years edition, graphically it's about the same, but FIFA get away with that every year too :P The real star in this years edition is the large roster and much improved creation tools, and gameplay tweaks to the controls (some such as the submission system are a bit of a faff but in fairness it's better than button mashing to win) , and revesals are vastly improved upon (you can see the shock as you power out on the other players face... hilarious). A lot more expressive animations and better cutscenes and comebacks this time around.Pros - Big Roster full of classic WWE era charcters, All DLCs and unlocks included free, better creation options, smoother gameplay, expanded and improved controls, loading times are massively faster than 2k15 at the price of a bigger 40gb install size, replays are much better now (in last years game they often showed no relivant action), career mode now has more things to do. Entry cutscenes are still poorly optimised and cause terrible frame drop... even though once the match starts it's fantastically smooth.Cons - Still no Diva career mode, Diva roster is improved but still missing many big names like Chyna (Thankfully there are plenty on custom downloadable area), some of the controls are still a bit sluggish and faffy to use (Submissions for example), Custom photo importing is still very poorly supported.Overall - Must have for Wrestling fans.

content:
Posted: March 25, 2016
												I love this game so much that I cry every time I leave my house because I'm not playing it then.And don't you dare buy WWE 2K15 over this game. Don't you dare. This game is everything 2K15 should've been. It fixes a lot of the faults that 2K15 had, plus it is way better optimized for the PC than than 2K15 was. If you decide to buy 2K15 but not this I will punch you in the face!Also, if you are getting stuttering during entrances like I was, I (sort of) found a fix. Go to your documents folder (under C:\Users\[insert name here]\Documents\WWE2K16) and go into the config.ini file. Once in it, change simple_lighting to on and then change audience_tessellation to off. It's not perfect because it will turn (current day) Sting and Luke Harper into black silhouettes during their entrances. However, if you go to into "advanced creation" for Luke and Sting's entrances, change the lighting to whatever lighting you want and it'll make the character models look normal again. For Luke I changed it to Undertaker's lighting and for Sting I used no lighting at all. Hopefully 2K will fix the stuttering in an upcoming patch. However, I never had any frame rate drops during matches.

content:
Posted: March 11, 2016
												So far from what I've seen, the game is entirely in working order, it runs just fine, and every single piece of content is here, unlike last time. So, as far as the port goes, it's safe to buy. As for the game itself, it sports a massive roster, more customization than you could ask for (except maybe create-a-finisher,) and the trademark Universe, My Career, and 2K Showcase modes. If you're a fan of WWE, or even just the games, this one is definitely one to pick up. My only real complaint I have with the game so far is that it's missing some of the old gimmick matches, such as the Inferno match, Casket match, and even the locker room and backstage brawls, however, this can easily be looked past by some. As I put more time into the game, I will update this revew with more problems or gripes I have with the game.

content:
Posted: August 21, 2016
												Submission system is broken, 2K still hasn't fixed it. The controls don't feel fluid and there isn't a decent tutorial or guide on how to play. The manuel that comes with the game doesn't give players a good idea of how to win their first match much less progress through the game. Want to create a custom character with your face or some celebrity? It's a complicated process that kinda works. The worst though is the AI... I've had the computer crawling on the ground yet it still finds a way to counter my attacks. I have had the computer down to virtually zero health and STILL lost the match because SOMEHOW it was able to get me into a submission hold. The counter system is also broken, with the player becoming frustrated at hitting the R trigger too fast or too slow and getting steamrolled by the computer AI. I had really high hopes for this title but not being able to progress from my first match because of the broken AI has left me requesting a refund for this title. I grew up playing Wrestlemania and WWE on N64... This is just a halfway decent title that would be better if 2K would take the time to fix these issues.

The submission system might make you break the original controllerâ€¢	You do not mind learning the new submission system, which most people on the consoles either liked or despised.â€¢	You do not mind staring at Stone Cold Steve Austinâ€™s armpits for at least 5 to 10 minutes. Or if you played WWE 2K15 on PC and only thought that the game could do with a bit more content (like more customisation, more in-depth MyCareer, more match types, more playable characters) and a bit more fluid movement, animations.â€¢	You read the reviews for the PS4, Xbox One versions of the game and still thought that you want to play this game. â€¢	You really do not mind the new submission system.Otherwise I cannot recommend this game to you.

content:
Posted: January 10
												First of all it's not a bad game neither it is a very good one.Pros-Amazing Character Design. Seriously numerious customization options are available.-WWE universe moments, although it kinda gets repetitive after some point.-HUUUGE amount of move-set options. And ability to mix and match your moves.Cons-Bad gameplay, just worst. I am not against Quick Time Events, but not only they have been used excessively, they are also buggy and make the fight just not look right.-Matches are slow paced. It doesn't give you the feel of fight.-Reversal mechanic is just awful. You've got 3-5 bars, if they fill up you can do reversals. Enemy AI seems to be so accurate. And once you passed your queue on that bars, oh it's downfall from there. You do reversal, ai does reversal but in the end he beats you up and pins you. OH PINS!-MOST ANNOYING THING IN THE GAME IS PIN MECHANIC, It's plain stupid. It's just the worst game design of all.You might be winning the fight but just because you passed on that small spot, All that time will be for nothing. Who makes pin mechanic an accuracy action. Why not mashing, why not something else. :(-Most minigames are stupid. Takes your eyes away from the fight. You can't even watch the move you are doing while doing those minigames.-The career mod; you have to do 600 matches or so to get to fighting rating 84 or so. That slow progress frustrates you.Well i kinda regret buying this game. I thought i would find action and badassery in this one. But all i find was minigames and character creation. Think again if you want to buy this.
