number of helpful: 8 of 14 people (57%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 19, 2016
												Awful game do not buy.I decided against my better judgement to give wrestling games a try again, what a mistake that was. The port is very poor, the game always launches in windowed mode regardless of what you have it set to, there's tonnes of screen tearing even with v-sync on and entrances can very often tank the fps. While the roster is very large there are some glaring omissions like Kurt Angle, Eddie Guerrero, Rey Mysterio, Rob Van Dam and Hulk Hogan, however Hogan is a more complicated issue. many of the characters are not in career mode and are mostly just there for free play. The In ring gameplay is ok some of the new systems like the submission mechanic are downright awful but for the most part it's ok.Career mode is where i spent most of my time. You start out in NXT and slowly climb the ranks till you face Finn Balor for the NXT title and then you are moved up to the main roster and can choose a belt to go after, The ambitious man that i am i went for the WWE title. For a while career mode was good i had a storyline since I'd come up from NXT which basically boiled down to the authority thinking i wasn't good enough. on the way to my first pay per view i had lots of cutscenes and interviews that helped develop the storyline which culminated in a ppv match against big show and kane. After that the story continues and advances to Triple H attacking me himself and running in on my matches, again lots of cutscenes and interviews to advance the storyline which ended with a hell in a cell match against Triple H where i pedigreed Triple H through the cell ceiling. This is where career mode took a turn for the worse, by this point i was pretty happy with career mode I'd had a good storyline and good matches but that all ended here. After the hell in a cell match i had no more storylines no more cutscenes nothing i was 4th in ranking for the title at this point and i was just playing matches against the likes of Ryback and Mark Henry over and over. Sometimes a wrestler would run in on my match and it would start a feud but after the run in it's back to the same old random matches and then i got a normal match at the ppv with a rival I'd have had no buildup for. Then the next night on raw the same wrestler i just ended a rivalry with comes out and starts it again so it's another month of the same match over and over to end in a ppv with no storyline or buildup.By this point i was getting pretty bored of career mode and was considering uninstalling the game when i saw the next PPV was the royal rumble and i thought there's a storyline to be made there, then i got in a rivalry and thought ok i can eliminate this guy at the rumble and get the title shot this might be ok. Then the royal rumble came along and i saw i wasn't in the rumble even though i was the number 3 contender for the title, after some frantic googling to find out why it turns out if you are in a rivalry you can't do any special matches at a ppv so no money in the bank no royal rumble which is the dumbest thing I've ever seen if you made it so no one in a feud could be in the rumble then there would be like 3 people.By this point i thought well ok I'll get in a feud with the rumble winner and make the title match a triple threat, well you can't do that either because the game doesn't tell you who won the rumble. After some more googling i found out it doesn't matter anyway because apparently the AI doesn't cash in money in the bank and doesn't take the rumble title shot so i thought I'll play till mania and get in a feud with the title holder then it happens... the message you are locked in a rivalry with a mystery opponent pops up I'm thinking ok another actual storyline this might be ok. Well as it turns out it was Triple H, i started getting the exact same cutscenes as when i started the game so i was playing through the single storyline this game has twice instead of getting the title shot at mania. After that i decided to just skip all my matches until money in the bank and go that route. I remembered not to get in a rivalry with anyone before it so i could be in the ladder match and on the day of the ppv I'm in a normal match with Kane even though i'm the number 1 contender.The reason I'm telling this story is because anyone buying this game should know what they are in for a grind fest playing the same matches every week, no storylines, broken mechanics, and the game â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ing you every time you try to make a storyline yourself.The career mode was very obviously rushed out the door and not play tested because anyone who is even a casual fan of wrestling would pick up on some of the â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥t in this mode like the fact that once you turn heel it's impossible to turn face, it considers hitting someone with a chair in the Tables Ladders and Chairs match a heel move, if you get thrown out of the ring the game acts like you ran out the ring and it's counted as a heel move however there's nothing the game considers a face action to counteract this. The pay per views are laughable most of the ppvs in the game none of the titles are defended and at night of champions the one where all titles are defended one is defended. You have to be very lucky to be in a special match 99% of the time you will be in a normal 1v1 match regardless of whether it's mania, extreme rules, hell in a cell or the rumble.The custom wrestler creator is decent not great and once you've made your wrestler be prepared to shell out money for the skill boost or start out unable to wrestle.The only really good thing about this game is the entrance maker and even then you have to get a 3rd party program to get custom music for your entrance. Avoid this game at all costs unless you want Maggle Cole telling you how great it is to be on monday night raw even more than he already does.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 13, 2016
												A good PC port, if lacking in graphics options such as model, object and environment detail, but is a much better improvement over the previous game. I'm not a wrestling fan, but even I love this game, with its vast customisation, game modes, character roster and sheer amount of replay value is incredible.Running at a locked 60 fps, WWE 2K16 sees the return of many favourite game modes, like create-an-arena, create-a-diva, match types, a whole new career mode and much more. The graphics seem better than WWE 2K15, especially with the character models and costume textures. Gameplay wise, I'm loving all the match types and going into the options menu to change rules, game hints, blood on/off and so forth. And speaking of, I also love the new mini-game-like QTEs that happen when actions like a pin, or grapple, occur. It adds a simple layer of 'fun' on-top of what is already a fun, meaty game. I love making my own movesets with my characters, making an entrance for them, and an arena for them to battle in. It's just incredibly fun and you'll be here for triple digit hours with it all!I haven't tried online, so this is an offline review. Having said that, a couple of things I want to see added in for the inevitable sequel is better audio design. What I mean is - I want to hear the occasional character scream or grunt as they pull off certain moves; giving it immersion by proportioning realism onto what is already a realistic game. Also minor, yet near-essential things like hearing footstep noises, climbing the ladder/cages, more variety in 'punch' sounds beyond the generic slap noise. And finally, better flowing commentary: it's quite jarring hearing the commentary suddenly cut-out to talk about something else I'm doing without finishing the previous sentence.Overall, as I said, I'm not a wrestling fan at all and I doubt this game will turn me to one, but I'm very much enjoying my time with this game. Perhaps a little more violence wouldn't hurt with enhanced persistent character damage, floors being scuffed and whatnot as per real wrestling. Having said that, this is a much better, improved, real letter to the fans that were left disappointed by the previous iteration or like me, just lost interest after so many features were dropped.Recommend to people who enjoy sports, brawlers, RPGs, simulators and action. Worth the Â£35 asking price? Definitely!

												Is this game buggy and terrible? Yes.Is this games My Career very WWE feeling? Yes, it attempts to have very silly story lines that make no sense just like you would expect from wrestling.Is this game enjoyable? Very much so, but if you want to win expect to play more like a rythm game rather then a button masher, it is very timing based to not screw up.This game is buggy but the bugs actually make the game feel more WWE because it adds to the stupid that is the WWE. But with that said if you want to get far in the my career your success will be very much based on what you level up and your move set, you can screw up a build making it very hard to win even on easier difficulties.All in all the game is much like some bad movies, its one of those its terrible which makes it great. Would I spend $50 on it? No, but you can always find a discount code at GMG or wait for a Steam sale and it is pretty enjoyable to play. I picked it up for $36 and am not disapointed, specially since 2K15 is still $50 as well.

content:
Posted: March 17, 2016
												This is the best strategic wrestling game of all time thus far, as someone who has been around for a while and played them all that is my personal opinion.  For the first time there is a real tension and back and forth feel to online play just like the kind of tense moments you get in a Wrestle Mania main event in WWE PPV. I am going to give the game a recommendation and thumbs up because of the above thoughts about this game however there is a big con for me with the online experience.1 on 1 normals matchs is the only match type you're able to play online in this game unless you have a heap of friends with the game who want to play with you. I enjoy the normal matches very much but it should be so much better than this. As with all large corperate game companies nowdays, you make a great game but you have no clue how to make a compelling online exerience or more likely just do not care. The system for match making is one of the worst matchmaking systems in history.  Multiplayer has been carelessly tacked on at the end and to hell with your playerbase that enjoys online competition. I don't even see leaderboards this year which makes it a downgrade from 2k15 in that aspect.  I want to be able to get into a 1 on 1 Hell in a cell match at the very least and I want to be able to at least comunicate GG at the end of a great match without having to say it through a always turned on mic. Is that too much to ask from a modern wrestling game? I think not.Easy Fix imo - Remove all the unnessassry match options from the selection screen, which are false advertising since no one can find a match in any of them. Implement 4 options instead which will be 2 players - 4 players - 6 players.All the players get put into the same lobby and pick one of these three options. Once the players are all in we enter a vote for which match type it will me and bang .. done. We dont bother with caws online, we only care about fast effiecient matchmaking.You done ****ed it up

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 24, 2016
VS CONSOLEI've played this game previously on the Xbox One. According to the Xbox, I have played at least 264 hours on it. So how does the PC version stand up to the console version? I think it holds up very well. The game does have a few crashing problems for me, but so did the console version. The PC version also loads up 10x quicker than console. It would literally take a minute or more to load into a match on the console. For PC, it takes about 10 seconds.GAMEPLAYIf you're looking for an arcade like wrestling game, I'd suggest looking for a different title. But for someone looking to play a wrestling simulation just like the TV show, you will love this game. The pacing in matches is fairly slow to start off as you perform lock ups. You then transition into your normal grapples, leading into back and forth action. You have limited reversal, so you have to use your reversals wisely. As you get into the big heavy hitting moves, you start to feel the exhaustion as your wrestler fights with every last strength they have. Every time you kick out from a person's finisher, you feel like you're out of breath as you and your opponent can't believe you still have fight left in you. Believe me when I say, you will feel extremely satisfied when you kick out of a finisher without using your resiliency. And honestly, it's hard to get upset after losing a match when you know you put up one h*ll of a show.CREATIONSFor creations mode, you have a decent variety of things to create. You can create your own Wrestler (Cool looking or just plain wacky), you can create your own title belt, your own arena, your own show, and unlike 2K15, you can create your own Woman Wrestler (or Diva, as WWE likes to call them...). The customization for your wrestlers are very good. I have been able to create some very life like wrestlers, especially with the face import tool (where you can import any face you want and use them for your created wrestler). Create a move-set is still there of course. Create an entrance is better this year, with nearly every wrestler's entrance as an option, as opposed to very little. Unfortunately, still no custom themes (but there are mods for that...)MYCAREERHonestly, I played this on the console version and was VERY bored with it. Very rarely have I ever gotten cutscenes and storylines. Aside from the mandatory feud with Tyler Breeze in the beginning. I don't quite have much to say for this mode since I kind of skipped out on it. I'm currently trying to go through it again for PC. So, hopefully I can give you updates on my thoughts for it.UNIVERSE MODESame sh*t as the previous years, nothing has changed, lol. You run your shows, create feuds. Get occasional cutscenes.

content:
Posted: April 17, 2016
												First Impressions Review:I think WWE 2K16 is an improvement over WWE 2K15 but it still has a lot of issues.What's Better:1) Create-A-Diva: '15 left out Diva creation '16 brought it in. Nice to know that 2K stopped being sexist.2) In-match optimization better: I no longer have the stuttering and performance issues during the match as I did with '15.3) Story Mode: They added a LOT to story mode, including rivalries, allies, picking which championship you want to go for, who you want to invade, all sorts of stuff! It's still got a grind factor, but there's a lot more depth in '16 than there was in '15.4) Match depth: There's a little more in-depth match mechanics like the various grappling mechanics which involve a back-and-forth mini-game of who can find the "sweet spot" first. But the game doesn't really tell you how to set that up...What's The Same:1) Graphics: Virtually the same engine. The audience is slightly improved. Superstars and the scenery are pretty much the same. Maybe some minor improvements...2) Overall fighting mechanics: Same huge sets of moves that are hard to perfect and rememberWhat's Worse:1) Submission: The submission mechanic is horrible. The system works like this: The defender has a blue bar, the aggressor has a red bar. The aggressor wants to have their red bar inside the defender's blue bar to fill up the circle in the center. If the circle is filled, the defender taps out. If it becomes completely blue, then the defender kicks out. Sounds fair, right? WRONG! If the body part is undamaged or fully damaged there's no real adjustment to how the mechanic works. It's all skill-based. I can understand that the bars should initially be based off of the wrestler's skills. But as the match goes on, there should be an equalizer. If you damage a body part, the aggressor should have an equalizer to help them get the submission win. What's the point of damaging a body part if you can't even take advantage of it...2) AI Kick-Outs: The AI kicks out ALL THE F*CKING TIME! An opponent I was against had no health, no stamina, just got Finishered, but STILL KICKED OUT BEFORE 3! This wasn't even the first time I had done the Special/Finisher combo. How are you supposed to win a match when the AI just magically kicks out ALL DAY LONG???? Then when the AI pins you, I don't even get a chance to kick out on the 1st count, have a tiny little zone for the 2nd and 3rd counts... The imba is real...3) Match Rating: The match rating was an issue with '15 and it's even worse in '16. They provide you with a meter in the HUD so you can see how "well" you're doing. Unfortunately, if you do a move once, it can no longer give you points for "variety." This game punishes you for using a move twice... Seriously? It should at least be diminishing returns instead of "you can use a move once, after that, too bad!" I guess the game really wants you to focus on ALL of those moves you picked in the character creation screen...For the $25 I paid for it, it's worth it so far. I hope '17 can address some of the issues that '16 has and finally get rid of those nagging issues leftover. Seriously, get rid of the match rating or make it actually worth having as a mechanic. I could get 4 and 5 star matches on '15 and I can't get above 3.5 stars in '16.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 24, 2016
VS CONSOLEI've played this game previously on the Xbox One. According to the Xbox, I have played at least 264 hours on it. So how does the PC version stand up to the console version? I think it holds up very well. The game does have a few crashing problems for me, but so did the console version. The PC version also loads up 10x quicker than console. It would literally take a minute or more to load into a match on the console. For PC, it takes about 10 seconds.GAMEPLAYIf you're looking for an arcade like wrestling game, I'd suggest looking for a different title. But for someone looking to play a wrestling simulation just like the TV show, you will love this game. The pacing in matches is fairly slow to start off as you perform lock ups. You then transition into your normal grapples, leading into back and forth action. You have limited reversal, so you have to use your reversals wisely. As you get into the big heavy hitting moves, you start to feel the exhaustion as your wrestler fights with every last strength they have. Every time you kick out from a person's finisher, you feel like you're out of breath as you and your opponent can't believe you still have fight left in you. Believe me when I say, you will feel extremely satisfied when you kick out of a finisher without using your resiliency. And honestly, it's hard to get upset after losing a match when you know you put up one h*ll of a show.CREATIONSFor creations mode, you have a decent variety of things to create. You can create your own Wrestler (Cool looking or just plain wacky), you can create your own title belt, your own arena, your own show, and unlike 2K15, you can create your own Woman Wrestler (or Diva, as WWE likes to call them...). The customization for your wrestlers are very good. I have been able to create some very life like wrestlers, especially with the face import tool (where you can import any face you want and use them for your created wrestler). Create a move-set is still there of course. Create an entrance is better this year, with nearly every wrestler's entrance as an option, as opposed to very little. Unfortunately, still no custom themes (but there are mods for that...)MYCAREERHonestly, I played this on the console version and was VERY bored with it. Very rarely have I ever gotten cutscenes and storylines. Aside from the mandatory feud with Tyler Breeze in the beginning. I don't quite have much to say for this mode since I kind of skipped out on it. I'm currently trying to go through it again for PC. So, hopefully I can give you updates on my thoughts for it.UNIVERSE MODESame sh*t as the previous years, nothing has changed, lol. You run your shows, create feuds. Get occasional cutscenes.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 14, 2016
												TL;DR --> From an objective point of view, it isn't that good and the pricetag really doesn't justify the content it offers, even if all the DLC is free on the PC version. That being said, if you want a more in-depth analysis, please keep reading.I've been a wrestling fan for around 10 years. I remember switching channels through my TV late in the night and finding a show that caught my interest: Smackdown! The main event that day was Bobby Lashley vs Batista vs Finlay and I won't forget that match easily.After that, I tried my first wrestling game by renting it from a local Blockbuster (does anyone stil remember those?). It was Smackdown vs Raw 2006 for the PS2. The controls felt a little bit clunky because it tried to be something it was not: a grappling simulator. However, I enjoyed every single moment I spent on that game just because I could recreate what I saw on the show and fight with my favourite wrestlers.Fast forward to 2016 and I'm still playing the same damn game with an updated roster and a graphic mod.The main problem with WWE 2K16 is exactly that, they've been doing almost the same game for 10 years. Sure, they've added more game modes, characters and other stuff. They have even improved the grappling and striking system to make it more fair when playing with friends (oh the times when you had infinite reversals and they were performed just by smashing a button).If you're a hardcore wrestling fan like me, you will probably enjoy this game, even if it has really strong weaknesses as a a PC port (fps drops, physics crashing, animations glitching...) and even if it adds nothing at all to previous WWE games but a wider roster that doesn't involve repeating the same superstar in different time periods (I'm looking at you WWE 13 and your 3-4 versions of Triple H).However, if you're looking for a fun sports/fighting game this probably isn't the correct choice for you.

												WWE 2K16 is amazing...ly bad. Every time I find something to like about this game there's something else that is just horrible. Basic gameplay is solid but submissions, chain grappling and the new pin system are all complete nonsense. It looks beautiful but runs like chunky crap for a lot of people. There are awesome custom downloads for characters, logos, title belts and arenas but you can only download 20 total per day and the servers are constantly having issues. It goes on and on. 2K simply have no idea how to keep themselves from screwing up wrestling games. They seem to think that they need to reinvent the wheel but at the same time have no idea what the wheel is. At best WWE 2K16 is a fun distraction but you are just as likely hate it 3 minutes later. I just can't recommend anyone pay money for this unless you are desperate for a WWE game to play.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 16, 2016
												Haven't regularly played a wrestling game since Smackdown! 2 on the Playstation. Saw a good deal on WWE2k16, figured what the heck, I'll try it. There's a lot to like in the game, but matches can often go from fun to absolutely infuriating based on the dumbest things. I get that handicap matches are supposed to put the player at a disadvantage, but there should not be the *added* disadvantage of having the game ignore you when you're trying to target a specific opponent. For example, in the Showcase, there's a Stone Cold vs. Vince and Shane McMahon ladder match. I can't even count how many times I would turn Austin towards Shane and try to strike or grapple, only to have Austin magically spin around and flail in Vince's direction. The game's decision for when you can or can't target someone seems completely arbitrary.Similarly, attempting to grapple an opponent standing right in front of me works 90% of the time, but 10% of the time, inexplicably, my character just sits there doing nothing, allowing the opponent to recover, often costing me the match. This is inexcusable.On top of that is the counter system, which basically turns every match into a game of chicken to see who's going to blink first. If I have four counters, and my opponent has four counters, the first one to use a counter is at an *immediate* disadvantage for the remainder of the match. For example, let's say Austin vs. Rock, each with four counters. If I'm Austin and I counterattack to get out of a bad situation, Rock has 4, and I have 3. That means my BEST CASE SCENARIO is Rock counters (3,3), I counter (2,3), Rock counters (2,2), I counter (1,2), Rock counters, (1,1), I counter (0,1), Rock counters (0,0). We're now both empty, but because he got the last counter, he has absolute control of the match, and I can basically just put my controller down and walk away for a minute or two, because I can't do ANYTHING. Counters recharge over time, but as soon as I've regenerated one, he's regenerated one too, and he's still controlling the match, which means I HAVE to use mine first, but as soon as I do, he'll use his, and he's back in control again. There's actually some strategy into how this can work in a tag team match or triple threat (though those come with the targeting/nonsense mentioned above), but in a singles match, the counter system effectively punishes whoever uses it first. On top of all that, the game either has no real tutorial, or has hidden it well. The NXT career and Showcase modes offer some tips, but leave others out, and there seems to be no rhyme or reason to what is and isn't taught. For example, the game teaches you the submission minigame, but never teaches you how to actually start a submission on an opponent. It teaches you the collar-and-elbow tie-up minigame, but never teaches you how to initiate a collar-and-elbow tie-up. Never tells you how to climb ladders or cages. Never tells you how to target another opponent.It's frustrating, because when the game isn't being super â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ annoying, it can actually be fun! But the moment your character randomly decides not to grapple when you're telling him to, or decides to target someone outside the ring instead of the opponent standing next to him in the ring, the fun instantly stops; all that's left is yelling at your monitor.

content:
Posted: April 5, 2016
												The last WWE game I played was Smackdown vs Raw 2010, so compared to the other 2K games I have no idea, but this game is nowhere near as good as SvR.That being said, 2K16 is actually pretty good in its own right. It has a huge cast of wrestlers (RIP Hogan), graphics and animations are good and fluid, commentary is actually much better than it previously was, and the gameplay is pretty fun and impactful although you will need some time to learn it. Customization is very poor and that's probably the worst part of the game. Lack of music for entrances and overall entrance motions, almost every hat is entrance only, and there is just a lack of good clothing options so I hope you like using the logo upload manager.In terms of the port it's acceptable. The entrances are all locked at 30fps and the game has serious audio and frame rate issues most notable during the after match replays and the 30-man Royal Rumble.Despite this, It is still a damn fun game to play and there is just so much other content to enjoy that makes it worth getting.

content:
Posted: February 20
												I enjoy the game mainly for the creative modes, but the gameplay can be very irritating. I've never seen a game dominated by a single stat/mechanic such as this one. The reversal system is frustrating. While fun to watch on screen, having fewer max reversals than your opponnent immediately put you at a large disadvantage, which makes the MyCareer mode that much more difficult. When you're out of reversals, you're basically helpless to defend against the opponent. It's a basic system of wrestling, so of course reversals need to be in the game, but it feels like the game is dominated by the system so much that you might as well just put your controller down until your reversal bar fills.

content:
Posted: September 25, 2016
												I bought the game from Humble Bundle (It's currently cheap.) All of my play time has been me TRYING to get the game to run past the splash screen. It crashes every single time, I haven't installed any mods or even played a single match. I know my computer can handle the game as I pirated it before I bought it to see if it would play well. I've tried the fix everyone praises fixed their game, it worked one time and got me to the main menu, but I had to restart due to a scrolling issue; I haven't seen the menu since..... Here's my suggestion:If you really want to play the game, either buy it on console or pirate the game without the update, at least it will work that way...EDIT: The issue was with the WIndows 10 Anniversary Update, so after a clean install of Windows 10 and a re-update to the Anniversary Update the game now launches, but will not go fullscreen without a Borderless Window app. It plays well, but I feel highly inconvinienced (I know W10 isn't officially supported, but it's still bothersome when compatibility doesn't work). So if you have Windows 10 build 1607, pass on this.I brought the issue to 2K support, so hopefully it doesn't happen with 2K17.

content:
Posted: August 30, 2016
												WCW/NWO Revenge for the N64 is what I want in a wrestling game, this is not that type of game. I wouldn't even classify this as a game, more like a very slow, drawn out rhyhthm game. I have yet to even come close to winning a match. Here's how a typical match for me goes. Throw a punch, throw a move or two, get reversed. CPU on offense now, try to reverse, too fast, wait for CPU to finish move, try to reverse, too slow, wait for move to finish, try to reverse, too fast, wait for move to finish, try to reverse, too slow.......and so on until it comes to the submissions, oh lord the submissions are terrible. Rotate the thumbsticks to avoid your opponent, sounds easy enough. Get put in a submission, move up, it's not moving up, try to go left, WTF it went right, get submitted..you lose. The game does look good though and I like where after the match I get interviewed by Rene Young, though I'm not sure how serious I am taken when I'm 0-20 and talking about being the greatest living legend in WWE.

content:
Posted: September 21, 2016
												This is probobly the best wrestling game you can get on a pc.Lots of fun features and customisation.You can interupt your openents entrance,i like that there are no loading screens between entrances and the start of the match.MyCareer mode is fun in the begining but after a while it becomes realy dull and repetitive.Anouncers are quite buged aswell, sometimes they repeat the same line twice or the call a reversal when a wrestler didnt reverse,a few times anouncers even called a male wrestler "she".The customisation is also not too bad.You can change practicly everything, but that is also the downside of this game.I've spent some time making a few arenas, custom championships and i edited a few superstars to create my own show in a universe mode.It worked fine for some time.But recently for no reason at all the game just started crashing after almost every match.I have also expierienced quite a few crashes during wrestlers entrances.Sometimes the game even crashed while performing an OMG moment on the anuncer's table.It just seems that the game can't handle all the customisation it lets you do.Overall it's not a bad game but all the crashes and model glitches that i encountered makes me say that i dont recomend this game if you like customisation since it will just make you feel frustrated after having to edit things because the game could not handle a wrestler or arena etc.

content:
Posted: April 15, 2016
												I bought WWE 2K16 hoping to be take advantage of the excellent community creations feature so I could make my own custom rosters and shows in the WWE Universe mode. However, there is an issue with the game where all community creation downloads are corrupt once you have too many custom creation files associated with your save. Many users have also reported bugs that completely corrupt game saves, meaning they have had to delete hundreds of hours of progress. Aside from these issues, the general performance of the game is unimpressive. Yuke's PC ports of WWE 2K15/16 have been subpar and have not been adequately supported with patches. It is extremely unlikely that I will buy another WWE game for PC, having been ripped off for two consecutive releases. If you want a WWE game and own a PS4 or Xbox One, buy it for that platform instead.

number of helpful: 5 of 9 people (56%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 7, 2016
												Well, we all love wrestling and we all want to be wrestlers ourselves, right? With this game you get a chance to be a wrestler yourself. But honestly, if real wrestling is just half as exhausting and frustrating than this game I don't want to be a wrestler.TL/DR at the end. ;)The game is really nice with all it's possibilities to create a unique superstar and the career mode. What killed the game for me was only the bad coding.The loading times are way too long, it feels like you have to wait forever before the editor/match/whatever has laoded.I could live with that if the ingame-perormance was okay. Well, it isn't. I don't have a high-end gaming machine but it's decent enough for most games (specs on the end of this review). The problem is that the FPS drop massively during the entrance (in the entrance-editor too) as well as when more than 2 wrestlers are in the ring. I've set anything in the graphics options as low as possible except the resolution but the framerate didn't increase much.Besides this issues the game is actually very fun to play. You have a lot of possibilities to customize your superstar as well as you may customize already existing superstars. The graphics look nice (not really up to date but still fine).The gameplay itself is more complex than I first expected but really easy to learn (yet quite difficult to master IMO). Summary:I really wanted to like this game but I just can't. The technical issues just outweigh the rest of the game. I bought the game when it was on sale for about 13â‚¬.I would recommend this game to you if you were a huge wrestling fan and if this game was on sale. For the regular price, I definately would not recommend to buy this game.System-Specs:CPU: AMD PhenomII 1055T (6x 2.8GHz)RAM: 8Gb DDR3 @ 1333MHzSSD: OCZ Agility3 128GbGPU: EVGA Nvidia GTX 560tiOS:  Win 10 Pro 64bit

content:
Posted: August 22, 2016
This is my first wrestling game since 2002.It was on sale for 75% off so i thought why not.I had looked at all the negative reviews,but seeing as i just wanted abit of fun like the old days i decided it would be ok.WRONG!The controls are atrocious,back on the old games in the 1990s to early 2000s the controls seemed more action oriented.More fluid, The amount of fun me and a friend used to have playing TLC matches was staggering.Constant on your seat intense jumping around excitement. Technology is the culprit here, now they can do more advanced motion capture,they try to make it as real as possible,and that's where i see the problem.For me it needs to be more fluid, more action oriented. With this game it seems like your a walking pile of concrete, so slow. everything is so slow.Slow to move,slow to get up,slow to climb.That's just not fun.Seeing as ive not played one of these games for 14 years i have no idea when this started to happen but these games used to be alot of fun to play.The grappling system is one of the stupidest things ive seen in a game,completely doesn't work,reversals don't seem to work either,either your too fast or too slow.They don't give you enough time to time it right,same goes with being pinned and submissions.  Im old school, track and field old school, button bashing is the way to go when trying to get out of a hold.The graphics are also not as good as they could be.I love realism,but a game like this can only add realism if it can keep things fluid and exciting. They are unable to do that which results in slow and monotonous gameplay. Overall id say if your a hardcore fan and you like things to be slow and have more realism sacrificing action and silly gameplay then you will probably enjoy it.But for me and anyone wanting what i wanted don't buy this even if its 99% off. I spent 12 hours downloading this, Wasting time i could of used downloading my other games and taking up 40 gig. Im going to try and play abit more but i doubt it will stay on my drive for long.

content:
Posted: November 14, 2016
												I've had a bittersweet experience with this game. I first bought it directly from steam, and despite having a more than optimal hardware configuration for playing it, an error would appear every time I tried to launch the game. After trying all possible methods, I got annoyed, uninstalled it, and asked for a refund.After almost a year, I happened to win a key for the game in a giveaway. I decided to give it a try once again, only to find the exact same error whenever I tried to launch the game. This time I decided to read the threads in the game's dicussion forum, almost one by one, until I found a solution I've not tried before (apparently it was a new solution). To my own surprise, IT WORKED! And so, I was finally able to play the game to my heart's content.I'm really happy with this game! Sometimes the FPS drop drastically while loading some of the entrances, but besides that it works like a charm. Sure, it may take an entire minute to load at first, but it's worth it. IF the developers had not abandoned this release in order to work on the newest version, things would've been different, and users wouldn't be rating the game as badly as they're doing now. Nonetheless, if you manage to "skip" the errors it throws at you while launching the game (the ALT+tab during Steven Austin's splash screen saves lives), you'll find it's an enjoyable experience. It has really good graphics, nice animations, a challenging AI, and an impressive roster!So, I give this game a thumbs-up.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: October 12, 2016
												I used to play wrestling games on the N64 and I haven't liked any of the newer ones I had tried, but I heard 2k16 was supposed to go back to the roots and try to make a better experience.  I personally didn't have any good experiences with it. First, when it is in full screen I still have a bar visible on the top and one side of the screen, it is annoying, but not a big deal.  For me the worst part of the game is the wrestling. It feels like the entire combat is based on reversals. The reversal system requires you to press a button at exactly the right time to reverse the move. It sounds ok, but by the time the indicator shows up to press the button it is too late if you try to anticipate it coming up it will say you pressed it too early.  This makes it very hard to successfully get a reversal and can mean you spend the entire fight trying to get a reversal or lose. My first match I only got one or two hits in the entire fight. Which, leads me to another issue there is no tutorial or training mode. Well, there is a tutorial, but you need to use a create a wrestler to do it, and there is no way (that I know of) to go through it again other than creating another new campaign. While you can make your own matches to practice with there is no dedicated training room like other fighting games have.  The pinning system is also very annoying. A wheel will pop up and start filling up you have to press a button to stop it while it is in a specific zone to kick out it sounds easy, but it goes so fast it is very hard. Now I've read a lot about the reversal and pinning issues online and most people seem to think you just need to keep playing to get used to the timing, well I didn't get to that point when I had a (for me) game breaking bug. I made a create a hero started doing the campaign and very shortly after I had an issue where it failed to save or let me load a save.  I tried every suggestion I found online except completely reinstalling (because if it happened once whats to stop it from happening again?) with no luck.  While looking online I saw someone lost a save with over a hundred hours on it. Fortunately, I only lost about an hour or so, but if this is happening to other people and with far more time invested than me, why should I or anyone else put time into it when we could lose it all to a bug that there is no known way to fix or prevent? Even if I could get adjusted to the reversal and pin system I cannot recommend a game that can randomly corrupt a save that people have put hours into.

												Very fun game. Pretty extensive character creator, decent career mode, lots of different moves, a good amount of different "modes" (single, tag, elimination, cell etc) and you can both upload your creations or download the community's. Exceptionally fun when you can get a few friends together (mp modes include up to 6 people).BE WARNED though, not worth full price in my opinion. While I do genuinely enjoy the game I will fully admit it has its flaws and they show (awkward controls, career gets repetitive because it doesn't mix things up often enough, more managing options during career would've been welcome, etc). If you can look past some flaws you can find an enjoyable experience with WWE 2k16, otherwise steer clear.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 3
												This game is a weird mix of good and bad. The character editor is good, and the various universe modes are solid. The showcase mode is also quite enjoyable. The MyCareer mode will remind you of every reason why so many people stopped watching WWE in 2015. Usos and Reigns are booked to be stronger than you, no matter how well you play the game. The authority henchmen will also march down to the ring and frequently harass you and cause you to lose matches, also mostly regardless of how well you can play. The gameplay itself is inconsistent, with button hits occasionally not registering. The timing is also terrible, with "too fast" and "too late" messages often appearing simultaneously. The manual is less helpful than a homeless alcoholic trying to give directions outside of a gas station, and you will almost certainly spend sometime googling basic things like "how to enter and exit the ring" and "how to climb the ropes". All in all, don't bother getting it unless it's on sale; it's not worth the list price.

content:
Posted: January 8
												Oh god, where do i start with this game?First of all, I haven't played any WWE games since the PS3 titles like the ones with Smackdown vs. Raw kind.. so i was quite overwhelmed with the look and feel of this title. Being said that, the gameplay annoyed me to the greatest extent. My first match was probably a minute or few long, cause the bloody pinning system is really unnecessarily annoying. What is up with this timing crap? Maybe i'm too old school and liked the arcade feel better..Then there's the submission and the reversal systems. Oh my goodness.. and i thought the pinning was absurdly difficult for an old timer like myself. I'm not going to go in much detail, but the submission system is like a cat chasing a mouse, go figure. Ohhhh, but the reversal system.. TOO LATE, TOO EARLY. â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥.. how many times have i pulled my hair after failing to press the button at the EXACT â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ moment.I seriously hope that things are better on WWE 2K17, when it comes out for the PC (if it does?). Cause this game could've been fun for me.. and it is fun played with a friend, but these three systems are outright terrible.I've only managed to try out the career mode a little and it seemed okay. Character creation feels limited though. There were enough match types to go through just to please any professional wrestling fan, but even they couldn't help save me to be on this game's side.Can i recommend the game? Not really, unless you accept these downsides of the gameplay. But to each their own, really.

Product received for free
												[not free, but came in a bundle]Some background: I used to be a huge wrestling fan when I was younger and have very fond nostalgic memories of WWF: No Mercy, which I still consider the best game of its genre.  I came into this expecting a janky, arcade brawler to play with my friend.  What I got was a slow, clunky psudo-sim.  It may sometimes look the part but it feels like sludge to play.  Is it better than it's playstation predecessors?  Idk, never played them.  But this as a stand alone is trash.Under what circumstances would I recommend it?  If you have a spare 50 gigs you don't know what to do with and want to have fun in character creation for several days.

content:
Posted: March 14, 2016
												2K continues THQ's tradition of taking one step forward and two steps back as it presents new challenges for pins and submissions which go beyond creating a learning curve or providing a stronger difficulty. In many ways, it seems like an experiment not well tested then, on top of that, it seems to have disabled the AI from making each other tap out. Which, for those like me who like watching AI vs. AI matches in universe, means you will be watching long fights, with multiple finishers. Many of which could, and should of, ended with a submission, but for some reason the hold is let go and the AI decides to pin soon after.All in all, while I remain happy 2K is realeasing a PC version of this with all the DLC, after a decent first iteration and mediocre 2nd, something outstanding has to be part of the 2K17 package for me to buy this game 3 years in a row.

content:
Posted: May 5, 2016
												I took a bit of time to gather enough hours in the game to make a halfway decent review.So from the start the game was fun, since everything is new and interesting.The fighting gameplay is good, not amazing but good.If you learn to time right it feels balanced.After playing the game for 24+ hours I noticed the following:- Targeting system in matches with multipe AI's is really poor- Not possible to target the ref, only 'accidental' hits to knock him out- Bug in the game the ref does 3 taps but only counts 2- Rivalry is extremely boring and 1-dimensional- You are forced to enter rival matches without being able to do anything other than leave- Animations of post-scene interviewer is horrible, really bad modelling- Authority targets are sometimes impossible- No special entrances for custom character- Move search/filtering in move editing menu not search-friendly- In career mode, it's not possible to use chairs or anything even in extreme rules tournaments.  -> which is super annoying since you manager will throw in chairs in the ring which can't be used or you're disqualified- improving attributes takes ages and becomes very boring- Player base is really low and this makes online play with tag-team almost impossibleSo in general. the game gets boring very fast. You really need to enjoy wrestling and grinding to such an extend to accept this. The gameplay is just very lacking for a game which gets upgraded yearly. Feels like rushed and unpolished.

content:
Posted: December 7, 2016
												First game I've played in this series since 2008. It is hands down the worst game i've ever bought and this game has convinced me to never play another wresting game again. And I've given this game multiple chances, thinking maybe I just need to get the hang of it. But no. You can attempt to polish excrament but all your going to get is a soiled towel. The submission system is stupid and unresponsive. I've lost a game 30 seconds into the match because the cat and mouse system of you moving your right analog away from theirs is horrible. Try tapping out to a basic submission move with full health 30 seconds into the match. The pin system is horrible, even with a yellow chest if you get pinned you can still miss the kick out chance. No custom music, no changable controls. The story mode is boring, let this superstar run out on you. Go run out on that superstar, face said superstar 4 times before the PPV inwhich you guessed it, you face them again. This is 2016. Please learn how to make a decent game.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 29, 2016
												My review is based on MyCareer. I don't play the other modes:1) A lot more customization than last year. 2) The submission system somehow got worse than last year. 3) Easy mode is fighting ragdolls who forgot they have arms. 4) Normal mode is highly over-turned as far as reversals go. 5) The mini-pin game works well, if you are the PC. 6) The same constant interview with the creepy lady over and over and over. 7) The Authority seems like piece mail, and thier directives only make sense about 15% of the time whether you roll with them or against them. 8) The lack of interesting matches you get to participate in. 9) The same constant run in to start rivalries over and over. Overall, it's way better than last year, but that doesn't say a great deal. The developers are simply very lazy and anything resembling stories is non-existent. However, WWE 2K16 would be impressive if PS3 was still on top of the market.  I've bought this the last two years hoping for a decent my career mod as I grew up watching wrestling that doesn't exist anymore: Mid-South, NWA on TBS, AWA, etc.  While 2K16 is better, it's like claiming that eating a mud sandwich tastes better than dirt. Yeah, it's a little more complex, but it's still malnourising.In short, I'd hold off on buying this one because of the WWE Universe save corrupt issue and MyCareer is a repetitive, grindfest with the same runs-ins and interview, not interviews, over and over.

												Do not buy this game, Not even when its in sale.This game has to many flaws. Mainly because this game was meant for consoles and you notcice that right away.Targeting system:There isnt any,  You will find yourself calling out to the screen: no no that guy get the other one ! thats not what i wanted to do at all! and so on. the same counts with all other movement. you will fin yourself climbing the pole in the corner a lot without you intendiong to do so!Reversal:Unless you are superman you wont be able to time this correctly meaning you get ourâ™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥kicked untill finnaly, by chance, you get it right once but this is more luck then skill.Minigames:For some clashes between fighters you have to do certain mini games but there over complicated and not well explained at the beginning. this means that half the time you dont know what the hell your doing. also this makes the fighting look clunky and rushed by the developers.Interviews: Laggy as hell you will often get the same questions and it doesnt really matter what you say to the reporter she will always say the same thing. "well there you have it back to you guys" sure the game isnt about the interviews and stuff but its in there and im more like: do it right or dont do it at all!Tuturial:is â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥t the barely explain anything and you dont need to do it right in order to continu this means that the game progresses even though you still dont get it. why the â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ a tutrial in the first place then?Character creation:This is the only thing done right! you can costumize your character and make your fighter the fighter you want. character creation is really extended. and they did this very well.All in all the gameplay feels broken maybe its different if you play with a controller but this game is frustration simulator to me. the most fun i had was watching my friend who also bought this game freak out.

Movement often seems clunky instead of flowing smoothly, and many of the wrestlers look goofy.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 30, 2016
												A lot better than some of their previous ones. However, it still belongs in a pile of garbage. The moves have no clear indicators to when they are gonna happen so you can't properly reverse them. I'm not talking about moves just being hard to reverse, I'm saying that the characters just teleport to certain spots when they do a move and the reversal indicator is never properly timed. The submission system can either work or just spaz out sometimes. The game has very little in the way of proper introduction to some of the newer mechanics if you haven't played any recent WWE 2k games and that can really affect a match. In MyCareer mode you constantly get asked questions by a monster(mouth and eyes like to freak out) and the answers are very bland. The character creator is once again a couple steps forward and then a couple back. It takes forever for certain parts to load and sometimes they don't load until you have completely set them up. The game can still be fun if your a WWE fan, but I can't recommend it as a game. 2K has had so many chances to make a good WWE game, but it's just dissapointing that this one isn't as good as it should be. As I mentioned though, the game can still be fun if your a fan of WWE.

content:

												The game is great. Improvement from WWE 2k15, better optimization, better mechanics, career mode and 2k mode has improved. Once I played the game for a few hours, I wanted to play the Online, as expected, the game is pretty dead. Playing WWE games online were great fun, teaming up with a buddy and doing a tag team match against some other randoms, you would never know what to expect, how the match would turn out. If you do come across players, they are from a different country (US), as I live in Europe, this causes a lot of lag delay, It would be nice if we didn't share the same servers, but would the game be completely dead then? Anyways I have made a group to hopefully grab some Europeans/UK fans attention, Hopefully we can build up this group with a decent amount of players. You're able to plan a match in the group and hopefully enjoy the multiplayer without lag or delay.  Group -> http://steamcommunity.com/groups/WWE2k16EUOverall rating 8/10

Thumbs down for that lazy stupid idiot of a developer.Seems like that savegame corruption bug still exists. The first time i encoutered that bug was in WWE 2k13 and 2k still doesn't give a â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ about this problem. Lost my save files after 112 hours this time. Means I wasted 112 hours of my life again this year which I spend creating superstars, shows, arenas, title belts and playing MyCarreer mode. The game itself is great, the best WWE game so far in my opinion. Everyone who claims the WWE SvR (Smackdown Vs Raw) games are better says it because of nostalgia reasons. But the problem is that it's not reliable. 2k also promised to update the content on a regular basis. Well, I haven't seen any update for this game at all, no bug fixes, nothing. That's why I can't recommend this game for the full price even if it's one of my favorite games. After 145 hours, the game somehow is complete trash by now. I uploaded a backup of two of my CAWs and every time the save files get corrupted i just download them again. I also made 12 custom logos for my own show's PPVs. But every time I try to download them or something else from the community creations, all other logos, CAWs etc are getting erased. Makes the game unplayable for me. The game doesn't even inform me now the the save files are corrupted...Fix the mentioned bug(s) already you stupid idiot morons. In reality, guys like me who buy these games every single year hoping this bug will ever be fixed are the only stupid idiots. Try to resist guys and don't buy it next year.

content:
Posted: May 7, 2016
												The game is great. Improvement from WWE 2k15, better optimization, better mechanics, career mode and 2k mode has improved. Once I played the game for a few hours, I wanted to play the Online, as expected, the game is pretty dead. Playing WWE games online were great fun, teaming up with a buddy and doing a tag team match against some other randoms, you would never know what to expect, how the match would turn out. If you do come across players, they are from a different country (US), as I live in Europe, this causes a lot of lag delay, It would be nice if we didn't share the same servers, but would the game be completely dead then? Anyways I have made a group to hopefully grab some Europeans/UK fans attention, Hopefully we can build up this group with a decent amount of players. You're able to plan a match in the group and hopefully enjoy the multiplayer without lag or delay.  Group -> http://steamcommunity.com/groups/WWE2k16EUOverall rating 8/10

content:
Posted: June 25, 2016
												TL;DR: My save corrupted with no reason behind it, and the game is a general buggy mess. Purchase at your own cost!I really want to like this game, but in my 5 hours of play its become apparent that I don't want to continue this game.I downloaded it last night, spent an hour or so creating a wrestler, did a match, and then went to sleep.  I wake up, all ready to get into the career mode... and then learnt about how buggy the game is. I found the for some reason, every time I launch the game the ring appears completly pitch black, making it difficult to fight since the ropes are also black. There is a fix, but you have to do it every time you launch.  So I figured I could live with it, and kept going. I finished the tutorial, took a break, reopened the game.... and my save file suddenly corrupted for no concievable reason! I have had saves corrupt before, and they can be pretty depressing, but having read how common these corruptions are, I really don't want to have to face any more!Buy this game if you want a WWE game on PC, but any game that corrupts the save that quickly is a big no for me!

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 2, 2016
												I'm going to give the game a 4.5/10The graphics are pretty and there are elements of the gameplay that are fun however the gameplay feels very much simulator as opposed to arcade, which does have it's benefits however it makes the entire game slow, also doing the same move 5 mins later marks you down for points which is stupid. The create a character season seems really really dry, there is the option to have an enemy and a friend and that's about it, after a match you get asked a question by a blonde chick whos mouth is slighty too wide? You can then respond in 4 different ways and the characters voice sounds like it was done by a person imitating the generic male voice on Family Guy. It's worse voice acting than the original Resident Evil. I'm almost certain they done it on purpose as a poor joke that's totally failed to land.I miss the days of WWF Westlemaina 2000 / No Mercy / ps1/ps2 Smackdown games. These games by comparison were a lot more fun, they felt like they had a lot more to do in the career mode with so many alternating storylines and random events, the combat although straight up arcade was great fun.I guess this games saving grace (if you coudl call it that) is the ability to replay old matches or events throughout WWF history, I think they've been doing this for quite sometime now anyway so this isn't exactly new.When you're designing your charcter be sure to press X (on xbox360 controller) so you can preview items on a dummy charcter. Absolutely no idea why you can't preview them on your actual character as they're alreaded loaded on the screen. I assume this was a mistake as it makes no sense. Overall it's just ok, if you're lookin for a fun game then this isn't it. It's very dry and the combat relies on stamina management, stone scissors paper and other weak minigames to make it seem different, all you get is a slowed down game with a lot of the story stripped back.Once again the voice acting on the male create a character is absolutely shocking and whoever got paid to do it should spend that money on voice acting lessons.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 8, 2016
												This has to be the worst port I have ever tried to play, and I've played through Arkham Knight. To start:5820k @ stock16GB ddr4390x @ stock3x ssd raid 0 & samsung 950 nvme (tried installing on both)I first tried to load this up using my steam link. I thought "oh the feed is really choppy", which is weird as everything is wired. I shut the link down, and came upstairs to play. My fears were realized when I re-launched the game and the stutter remained. The game has a stutter that makes it completley unplayable. Every 1 second, the game locks for 1/2 sec. In the splash screen, in menu's, In benchmarks, in quick matches. 0I've checked the pc usage whilst running the benchmark.Cpu stays at a solid 15% usage. Memory @ 25%, vram at 30%. Gpu doesn't know what it wants to do. Shooting between 0-100%, but not in time with the stutters. I've got the latest crimson drivers, have tried all the .ini 'fixes', have tried changing literally every single graphics option, and it still chokes. I've reinstalled twice, to seperate drives 'just incase....'. Literally the only game I have ever played on this rig with this issue.A good pc port is one that gives a console like "launch and play" experience. This is not one of those ports. Thank god I got it in a humble bundle. Was thinking about buying the cd key solo, glad I didn't bother.If your thinking of buying this, I can only say this is my experience. I hope yours is better.

content:
Posted: May 8, 2016
												A must have for any wrestling fan.This is the definitive PC wrestling experience, and arguably the best WWE game yet. A huge roster of wrestlers, Stone Cold Steve Austin story mode, a career mode for your created wrestlers, create and download wrestlers/arenas/titles/logos. There is a lot to do in this game to keep you busy.Recommend playing with a controller. A patch was released just after release which made all the performance issues go away.A few downsides:- Elimination Chamber matches are bugged, you can get stuck in the wall (this happens on consoles too)- No custom music option like in previous games- If you don't like grinding for exp to improve attributes then you probably won't like career modeCan't comment on online mode as I haven't played it myself, I got this game more for booking my own shows, rivalries and events using universe mode (In my game Zack Ryder actually keeps a title for more than one day!)

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 8, 2016
												In terms of gameplay quality, it's a step in the right direction from last year's empty roster and disappointing career mode. This year's career mode doesn't end when it starts getting good this time around, and the roster is sure to please most fans. The reason I can't recommend this lies in its poor optimization. Don't get me wrong, it's a step up from what we got in 2K15, but it's still a hack job. Only the Showcase mode and very misleading Benchmark ran at 60fps with no hitches. Once I'm in a normal match or MyCareer mode, it all falls apart due to random stutters making it near-unplayable. Literally no solution worked, therefore the main reason I bought this game was unplayable. To make matters worse, my specs far surpass what are supposedly the recommended specs.In short, you're better off waiting for the next entry in the series. Hell, I'd advise to pick up something like Shut Your Mouth or SvR 2006 for less than this. Please get yourâ™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥together, Yukes.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 12, 2016
												-----------------------------------------------------------------------The good:Way better than 2K15Sound and music are very goodRoster feels more balancedCena no longer always kicks out at 2Graphics are fair to good, depending on specs. I run everything at max settings and it's pretty good looking.Foreign objects do as much damage as they actually should nowSupposedly multiplayer is good, but I havent tried it yet (Same thing with MyCarereer) IF you buy the DLC, you actually get a good amount of things for what you pay forTitle managment (Not new, but fun as hell with all the options you are given)--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------The bad:For some reason, I had to use a 360 controller for my 2nd player, as a USB keyboard did not work.If you don't have a solid state drive, you have to wait about 5 minutes for the game to startup everytime (This has been fixed with the latest patch)A lot of characters use the same animationsOdd, slow motion glitches when characters go outside the ring area (announcer table, intro lane) and this is not graphics, it does the same thing on low settings for me (Fixed with latest patch)Some ladder and tag team matches work, but i have crashed about a fourth of the time trying both of those (Stability for theses matches has increased greatly with the latest patch)Apparently if you use AMD this game pretty much won't run and the devs don't plan to release fixes for itAnnouncer repeat themselves OFTEN, More than 2K15 evenSound patches out when doing 4 or more characters in 1 match (This is no longer a problem, it has been patched)Crashes seemingly at random (Not often, it did twice in 2 days which is not that be IMO) when in the menus or loading screensCounters sometimes say "Too Early" or "Too Late' even when no button is pressed, leading me to belive the ocunter system is messed up (It works sometimes, but really feels like RNG)-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------All in all, you liked 2K15 or are really into wrestling, yes, I think you would be ok with buying it now. Hopefully they patch it soon, because the game did just release and it seems like these wouldn't be hard fixes.EDIT (3/29/16): The latest patch has fixed NUMEROUS issues, making the game feel completed now. I would most certainly reccomend this game right now, as most bugs and issues have been fixed. PC users can finally say we have an actual, good wrestling game now :D

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 12, 2016
												TLDR, dont waste your money on this trash.   This is my first review.   I have bought over 100 games through Steam, and this is by the far the worst.   I paid 50 dollars for glorified PC port.   And most PC ports are all trash.   First, there isnt any mouse support.   You have you hit space, return, esc to navigate the menus.   Second, the controls while wrestling are stupidly nonsensical.   Almost to the point of being absurd.    Games like Elite Dangerous ( a space sim) use a ton of controls.  Were every keystroke helps you pilot your ship.    But there is absolutely no reason to have a wrestling game need all the keys to control your character.   Its almost like they took the all the different combinations of movements & controls possible from a game controller and then mapped them to indivual keys.   That is ridiculously stupid.   3rd, there is no tutorial to help you learn the game.  Nothing, no instructions, no warm up matches - nothing.   You get dropped into it, and you have to figure it out.   4th, there are 2 "mini games" - and they are not fun.   1 mini game for submissions, and 1 mini game for kicking out of a pin.   But, there is no way to practice or learn either of these, until you are in a match.   And you will quickly lose the match, if you can't figure out the mini game fast enough.   Kind of important to have a tutorial on these things.  Last but not least, this simply isn't fun.   With a terrible control system 2k games took a potentially fun game and made a frustratingly bad game.   Almost forgot.   I had a friend come over and try the game.   The guy is a wrestling fan, and played a bunch of the console games.   He played all the older n64 wce and wwf games back in the day.   I let him play this game, and tried to talk him through how to play it, and he was completely shocked and how bad the control system was.   If nothing else, he saved 50 dollars.   Its games like this that explain Steam's game return policy.   But I want to take it a step further.   I want to be able to blacklist 2k Games from my Steam store.   I literally never want to see another game made by 2k games every again.   I never want to potentially buy another game from this developer.   Steam, can you make that happen?

content:
Posted: August 12, 2016
												7/10 ðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸIn my opinion, despite negitive reviews this game is pretty good for the price. True, the lags like a brick sometimes, even though I have much better than reccomended specs. As for career, I have experianced glitches, like the time when I was champion and the weeks before Wrestlemania and there was this storyline with me,Daniel Bryan,Seth Rollins and John Cena where you have to choose who to face at Wrestlemania. I chose Cena, as I find him the easiest to win agaisnt, however when Wrestlemania rolled around I faced Daniel Bryan, which I thought was weird as I chose Cena in the storyline. Then Daniel Bryan managed to beat me but after Wrestlemania Brock Lesnar was the champion and he wasn't even in the storyline in the first place. And now we have online,WWE2K16 features possibly the worst online I've ever seen. It is literally impossible to find a match, even for a normal 1v1 match. I've tried many times since I got the game back in February and have only found a match once. Despite these negitive facts,however, the graphics are good,aswell as the special effect animations for pay-per-views and championship matches, the gameplay is good,although it's a bit repetitive on career, and one of the biggest selling points for this game is the customization. The amount of things that you can change to suit how you want is probably the best of a game in the fighting genre, anything from apperance, to enterances, to custom championship belts and areas, you can do it all. Overall the game has its ups and downs. Is it worth the Â£35? I think so, if you can get past the fact of multiplayer being nonexistent,the odd glitch and sometimes having major frame drops, it is a good game, that I've had hundreds of hours playing.I also thought I should add that even though many people have had save data curruptions, I haven't experianced it, if I had have done, this review would be a very different one ;P

content:
Posted: July 8, 2016
												In terms of gameplay quality, it's a step in the right direction from last year's empty roster and disappointing career mode. This year's career mode doesn't end when it starts getting good this time around, and the roster is sure to please most fans. The reason I can't recommend this lies in its poor optimization. Don't get me wrong, it's a step up from what we got in 2K15, but it's still a hack job. Only the Showcase mode and very misleading Benchmark ran at 60fps with no hitches. Once I'm in a normal match or MyCareer mode, it all falls apart due to random stutters making it near-unplayable. Literally no solution worked, therefore the main reason I bought this game was unplayable. To make matters worse, my specs far surpass what are supposedly the recommended specs.In short, you're better off waiting for the next entry in the series. Hell, I'd advise to pick up something like Shut Your Mouth or SvR 2006 for less than this. Please get yourâ™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥together, Yukes.

content:
Posted: February 15
												Was really hopeful for this... just as a game to play with a mate online against ai but it's hugely disappointing. For all the crashes and bugs that have been listed, the reality is it's just not a good game.The game is so poorly optimised that even after workarounds, lowering the visuals and tinkering with files to balance the speed... the game has a general sluggish drag to the fighting and tends to grind to a halt at relatively demanding sections like retrieving the belt in a ladder match.The submission system is insufferable in particular, whilst the majority of minigame grappling and pin systems are just needlessly complicates.It's just no fun... if you can work past the feeling of playing on a time delay between pressing a button and a response... which is tricky on the mini games for sure, the chances are the ai will consistently reverse your moves to the point of tedium. Something which, again, would be just as regular against a person who can prejudge the delayed button response.Even if all this was ok and you could live with it, what's left isn't any fun. The games sluggishness destroys any flowing moves, particularly Ariel and running, as even the animations are weak. And don't forget the endless bugs and glitches (see YouTube ... they're funnier to watch than get lumbered with).Avoid. See 2k17 reviews and wait for 2k18 I guess.

content:
Posted: May 13, 2016
												It's buggy but mostly fun. It's not amazing. I'm not really sure it's worth the 50 bucks even with all the DLC that puts it over 100 on other platforms, but it's fun if you want a good laugh. The controls are awkward and the collision handling is pretty terrible. If you want to climb the turn buckle, it's the same button to do so as it is to tag your partner in a tag-team match, so sometimes if you want to tag out, you'll climb the ropes instead. And speaking of climbing the ropes... in a battle royal? Wanna jump off the top rope onto somebody, but there's somebody pinning somebody else, no worries, it'll just slide them across the ring and out of your way as you hit them on your way down. Yup.Further issues include the targeting/locking system or whatever. Multiple people in the ring? Wanna switch targets? Well, by default, 'smart' targeting is on, which is hilarious as it basically means you can't switch targets. So you decide to turn it on manual switching... awesome, do it mid match, that's cool. Next match, however, it's back to default. So you change it outside battle, that's a pretty obvious fix, right? Only if you actually think that the targeting switching actually works. Guess what, half the time it doesn't. Woo!Then there's the graphics, oh man, they're interesting. It's very very obvious which "superstars" (still cracks me the hell up that WWE insists that all it's wrestlers, oh wait, can't call them that, are superstars), they spent the most time on. Most of the models for the incredibly lacking NXT roster are outright garbage. On top of that, any mid-carder, jobber, or female wrestler also look like they were made in a weekend. And that's not even mentioning what they did to poor Rene Young and her teeth. Good god almighty, she should sue.However, this is the biggest budget WWE game of all time supposedly, which isn't really a surprise, it just points to the fact that 2K games and the WWE don't take their fans or customers very seriously, and that the annual release schedule is untenable and leaves everybody with an unfinished/unpolished product. Hence why I said it's not worth the 50 bucks. I'm still going to give a 'yes' as to whether or not I'd recommend this game, but with a few caveats:1). Buy it on sale, preferably at 50% or more off.2). You need to like buggy games. Some of us find the bugs funny, so yes, that's a legit bullet point, if you don't like them, don't buy it.3). You probably need to like the WWE, a lot. Even if you liked the old WWF and WCW games that were actually great back in the day, and you want to play a modern version, this isn't it. Those games are still more fun, I just wish they had an updated roster and graphics.4). You need to have a high tolerance for repetitive and awful dialog. Michael Cole and JBL are involved so... yeah, and Renee Young's entire voice part is pretty much to say "and there you have it, back to you Michael Cole".

content:
Posted: September 13, 2016
												I tried liking this, as I got it in a Humble Monthy Bundle, but it's just not fun. I enjoy/enjoyed wrestling when I was younger, and I remember the crazy and fun days of N64 and Gamecube wrestling games (both WCW and WWF/E). The fights there were simple and enjoyable; they were fast-paced and actually fun.If this is your first time trying a newer WWE wrestling game, this might not be what you're looking for if you're longing for the games of your past.The things I dislike about this aren't really the characters, graphics, or the fact that the audience still looks like creepy dolls, it's that the game isn't simple at all. There are mini-games for almost everything that suck the fun out of it very quickly--and they're not fun, chaotic mini-games, like mashing a button. The game is all about timing, and you can lose in under a minute if you're not perfect at it.Also, the load times are bad, especially in Create-A-Character, but I can look past that.Sure, some people like the game, but to me, it's too unnecessarily like a giant Quick Time Event.
