content:
Posted: August 10, 2016
												real review goes herei grew up on wwf wrestlemania 2000, and to a lesser degree wwf no mercy 64.  then i discovered the joy of the Gamecube WWE games where collision detection was added and a giant swing in a 4+ man match meant everyone got their asses knocked over.then i did smackdown vs raw 2008, 2009, 2010, and they were terrible.  wwe 13 was the last good game i did.  WWE 2k16 is basically that, but with more stuff, and that's pretty good.it's got probably the most diverse roster of any game i ever played.  i told a friend about it who is not a current wrestling fan, and they basically asked me "is insert-obscure-80s/90s-wrestler-name in it?" expecting me to say no, and I ended up saying Yes to every single one (names like iron sheik, though as colonel mustafa, dude love, randy savage, x-pac)they even have a large number of NXT roster in it so even almost a year after the game is out, it's current with stupidstars like enzo and cass, the vaudevillains, binn falor, samoan yusuf, KENTAAAAAAA, baron von chickenpants, killsteenkill, and so on.  this is the first double-e game where i've actually wanted to play as almost everyone in it.the new campaign mode is also something remarkable despite being a rehash of the exact same thing almost every we game has had fantasizing over the attitude era and bone cold beave austin.  this time you play as him throughout several matches in his career, following objectives to advance the matches as they historically unfolded,  with exact in-game recreations of events, movement, and motion from the matches, as well as clips of the original audio and audience noise.  even lets you play as STUNNING STEVE AUSTIN where you can marvel that wcw also had jerry lawler and jr on commentary wowthe steam-included DLC contains individual missionmatches in teh same vein for the wwe 2015 hall of famers, allowing you to unlock a bunch of excessive skins, variations of wrestlers, etc, from The Rock, to The Rock 97, to The Rock 00, even to The Rock 03.the in-game handling of grapples and strikes feels much smoother than before, though there's basically no information on the controls for certain grapples, leaving you to figure it out yourself or look it up online.  to counter boring counter-fests, counters are now limited and have to recharge over time, so if a cheating computer is countering everything you do, they can only do it up to 5 times in a short period of time before they can't counter anymore, although even then sometimes the cheating computer will cheat and be able to counter despite having no counter.the MyCareer mode has some fun and innovative bits like starting out in NXt, choosing which titles to pursue and earning your way to title shots, having story interactions where you can make bad decisions and give horribly generic interviews which can turn you face or heel.  the problem with MyCareer is that this is pretty much all it has for all the championships and it costs stat points and VIRTUAL CURRENCY to upgrade your stats, and you gain very little of those at first, and even when you start earning more after each match, everything starts costing more, so you end up going year after year in MyCareer mode grinding for points unless you cheat using CheatEngine and give yourself more.MyUNIVERSE mode is basically the same but you don't play as one custom superstar.  you don't even have to play as a superstar, but just arrange shows, set up rivalries, and see greater in-world interaction with stuff like injuries and women wrestlers.  little icons appear after each match showing some trait loss or gain, but there's no explanation anywhere as to what these icons even represent so i have no idea what any of them even mean, one of them is literally like a pyramid or something.there's also great deal of customization of arenas, i made one that looks like paint and puke, and is atrocious and has a Turkish flag on the side of the ring beneath an LED board for no reason at all.the wrestler customizations are limited, as it seems every year they completely pick at random what things to include or disclude from the games in terms of features and customization options.  the new facial morphing system allows for greater freedom of movement, but at the cost of being excessively difficult to manipulate, and having some seemingly arbitrary limits which leave you with such oddities as being able to smooth down the right jaw, but not the left jaw ever.  it's all very dependent on the new photo-face capture feature, where you have to take a very precise photograph of someone's face, then messily staple it onto the CAW's face.  some of these looks surprisingly good, but none of it even matters because the CAW facial animations end up making every face-morphed CAW look the same.some other things i really like are the little details in the game.  por ejemplo, iffin when you play as Bray Wyatt and you do a taunt, youll hear his voice shouting "follow the buzzards!" or "i'm the eater of worlds!" like real.  Paige also shouts and says "this is my house" and cass loudly spells out "S" "A" "W" "F" "T" with his siganature or finisher thing.this was prolbably the greatest wrestle game i've played since DAY OF RECKONINâ™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥nd just about as it came out on Steam and was on sale, they announce Double-E 2k17 with Goldenberg.  not cool

content:
Posted: March 11, 2016
												First of all let me start by saying that they have definitely made improvements from 2K15, You can feel that in the overall gameplay, You can see that in the added improvement to animations, reversals and general flow to the game.HOWEVER I have read that there has been a fair amount of criticism levelled at this game since its release, and unfortunately I find it all to be fairly well accurate.- first and foremost nine times out of 10 the game doesn't load past the Austin screen without fiddling around Ctl, Alt, Dlt, however that will be easily fixed come bug release time.And then there's the little nitpicking, The games FPS could be better, I'm playing on a GTX 980Ti and sometimes during entrances the frame rate drops dramatically, so that's definitely the game not me.And then we get to the criticisms levelled towards the game's highly anticipated 'my career mode'- The post match interview questions are far too vague, oh and it's a constant cycle of three, Yes, The creators of this game only put in a cycle of three different interview questions you can be asked...Evan NBA 2K got it better.And then there is the My career wrestlers voice, what happens if you are someone with dark skin?You're forced to have the most whitest sounding voice and it can't be changed.Yes they made a lot of improvements, and yes I probably would recommend it to a friend, but this game is still far from perfect, and there are quite a lot of bugs that need fixing.6/10 IGN

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 13
												2k16 is a mixed bag of a game. On one hand there's tons of detail on wrestler's gear, the ring, their movesets, the showcase mode.On the other hand the animations are inaccurate at best, the creation system is flawed beyond belief, the roster is surpirsingly thin, the shading is that of a game released in 2006 and not 2016, and everyones faces looks like action figures that got left in a car and melted.If you're a casual wrestling fan then this game is perfect for you. It's "Story Mode" is a complete career retrospective on Stone Cold Steve Austin and the gameplay is solid.If you're a more serious wrestling fan it's really hard to reccommend. Sure it's got a bunch of stuff from the Attitude Era but that's where the content ends. The roster was heavily dated when the game was released on consoles back in mid-2015 and like I mentioned before the creation suite is laughable. You can deck your CAW out in all the bells and whistles you want but it you can't get  just  the right picture of their face looking directly at the camera youre either going to look like Sloth from The Goonies or the blank slate default. You can't add in custom music without changing around files  however there is an online sharing system that allows you to download other's logos, custom arenas, movesets, and championship belts.All in all if you can pick it up on a sale for >$10 I'd say go for it but at $50 it's an insult. What I can recommend is buying a PS2 and a copy of Smackdown vs. RAW 2007 and going to town. But hey, at least it's not 2k17 where you have to pay for the DLC 8 months after it came out with the next iteration hot on its heels.

content:
Posted: May 23, 2016
WWE 2K16 Review From an Attitude Era Fanboy:Pro s:1. Lots of Superstars in the Roster to play with along with Infinite Community-Based Creations2. WWE Showcase featuring Stone Cold Steve Austin takes you back to some of the greatest matches of the Attitude Era3. WWE Showcase features Good Ol' JR, Jim Ross.4. Better WWE Career mode,way better than in WWE 2K155. WWE Universe mode has improved a lot6. Soundtrack Con s:1. Repetitive and Boring Commentary. You don't need  Punk's GTS to go to sleep. The Commentary does that.2. WWE Career Mode becomes repititive after a few seasons.Verdict:This is undoubtedly the best ever WWE game made as Stone Cold Steve Austin already said so.Get this if you are a diehard WWE fan.Otherwise there is not a great amount of improvement from the previous title.But considering the price, it is decent.

Posted: October 16, 2016
												Running on a 4790k 16gb w GTX1080 running Win10 64 bit 1080p@60fps  (2k dsr).Not 100% stable, but for the price I got it for I accept the occational CTD (2x in 8hrs).The 30fps scenes are no issue to me.Although never a true fan I remember watching WWF back in the day and enjoying the over the top entertainment - must have been mid to late eighties, early nineties. That over the top extravaganza made a lasting impression. Now I can reenact many of those fights playing (against) these old wrestlemania stars! The later generations of fighters are also great.To be honest I think this got me hooked and waiting on 2k17, but I am very much still learning the controls - not too intuitive, but the controle mini games are a nice challenge.This game is GREAT for local coop, my two boys and me mixing it up.Highly recommended, especially if you can get it at a sale!!

content:
Posted: April 6
												I will say all in all I enjoyed this game. As a long time fan, who recently returned to the show I haven't touched a WWE branded game in a long time. In fact the last game I touched was still titled WWF. From what I can tell the game has more or less what would be expected from a WWE title. Such as a creature your own wrestler, entrance, and so on. You also have online modes which was kind of a new thing in the older games and adds for a nice feature to play with friends, or those who want to prove they are the best at the game.The Showcase is pretty good as well, it was awesome going back and reliving Stone Colds career mixed in with live footage, and hearing JR once again brought back a lot of good memories..I will say the only thing that seems to be lacking is the career mode. I really enjoyed the moments from the WWF smackdown career modes where it played out more like a television show full of drama and backstage scene's no matter who you picked, even if you used a custom wrestler. Now you just wrestle, and then just wrestle some more with the occasional interview here, or run in there. Just gets boring real fast and lacks any story what so ever. Which makes sense with the amount of work they put into Showcase mode, but there is just so many times you can play that before it gets boring as well.The game also seems more of a simulation then it does a arcady game. Which is not a bad thing, but isn't everyones cup of tea.As someone who is new to the 2K series of game I have yet to suffer the effect of yearly releases and seeing this turn into a Madden like series with a new game released each year with little improvement over the last. However I know I write this review long after 2K17 has come out, but I had only owned the game a few months before 2K17 was announced so I can see the trend that this series has fallen into.All in all, from sound design to graphics, from modes to features, this is what "I" would expect from a WWE game and has not really dissapointed me. Would I recommend this game? Yes I would to a WWE fan, I wouldn't really suggest someone play it just because they enjoy games. It doesn't really have what it would take to suck in a non fan of WWE, but even games like Madden and NBK don't really draw in gamers who aren't already fans of the sport.

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 1, 2016
												This game has major problems, knowing the history of the developer "Yukes" you'll never see these issues go away. As bugs and glitches from 2003-2004 still persist today.First off they are still using an Outdated 15 year old engine. The third party havok physics etc. are added on top of it. It explains why when you create a wrestler each item takes ages to load. The game has to analyze the layer of clothes etc, it's amatuer and lazy development - considering other developers like iD software's John Carmarck rewrites engines from scratch for optimization.Much of the game does not really reflect the "WWE" experience or pro wrestling in general. It's a step above the old arcade button mashing and going in the right direction towards sports entertainment, I'll give it that. But it cannot decide whether it wants to please Wrestling fans, Casuals or "Multiplayer Annoying Competitive gamers who don't watch wrestling but brought this game to fight people online." Online play is basically people running around the ring and spamming one move just to win. It's sad, the Multiplayer Non Wrestling players are pathetic. There are less Wrestling fans playing this and more Multiplayer Button Mashers have sadly brought this.Alot of stuff hence becomes confusing to arcade gamers. Since they don't watch the show, they might not understand the significance of OMG moves etc.Showcase mode is Cutscene + QTE-fest. It relies heavily on nostalgia for engrossment.Yukes overlooks the best feature every year. And that is, UNIVERSE MODE. Yep, they still have no idea what to do with it, and instead spend all year focusing on Showcase mode. Universe mode now is more RPG like, but the A.I booking is trash. The realism is a joke, so much that you can call it amatuer and lazy development. Teams and stables are useless, no managers are possible in rivalries. And yeah simulate enough and your Wrestlemania main event is Darren Young vs Erick Rowan. Money in the Bank is thrown in half baked, you cannot play the match before cashing in.Custom titles have a glitch which doesn't allow the weeks to be counted.Rivalries are simply beatdowns.Stories have been removed.The personality and RPG Statpoints are so underdeveloped and pointless.5 chairshots will make the opponent instantly get up, thats the most realismn breaking feature. In universe mode they could have added realismn, not Mortal Kombat.Don't bother with career mode, it's a grindfest and half baked with a demonic looking Renne Young interviewing you.Create a wrestler is slow and painful to use. Create an Arena is fine and works okay. Create an enterance is pointless as you cannot change camera angles anymore, whats the point of having pyros if you can't allow the camera to zoom out? LAZY DEVS! Lets not forget the lack of good or usuable enterance themes.Another thing is that this game gives less custom stuff for you to use in creating shows, wrestlers etc. Transistion animations, enterances, music, titanatron are so limited. If people create stuff they don't want to use stuff that already exists.Largest roster superficially, 1/4th of the roster are duplications of Stone Cold, Undertaker and Rock.Lets remember, the guys who had the attention to detail in Yukes are long gone. This series is just a yearly cash grab, The graphics and engine are really showing it's age. Just see how stupid Paige, Seth Rollins etc. looks in the game.It's sadly the only good WWE game on the store, till it's 60$ addon comes out.

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 12, 2016
												Stupid submission minigames completely ruin the game for me. Dominating a match? Prepare for a submission move that you can't defend against while trying to make a blue bar run in a circle from a red one while your controller spazzes out and screws it up for you. Congratulations, you lost. But wait, you won this time, this time you got it! Maybe now you can win consisten...no, it doesn't work anymore. It did, but now it doesn't, because the bar doesn't respond to your input consistently, it just does whatever.I could go on about the game, talk about the atrociously long loading times with the classic loading bar that is merely the prelude to another loading of indeterminate lenght. Or of the nightmare inducing facial animations (that post fight interviewer will haunt me forever), the boring and irrelevant commentary, the stupidity of the stamina system, the rest of the controls that work whenever they feel like it.I'm glad I bought this game on sale, I would be upset at the waste of money otherwise.

Posted: June 9, 2016
												I pretty much play this game daily and I can say that this is one of the best wrestling game in a while. Most of the time I just play universe mode, but this years mycareer mode is more indepth but I personally don't enjoy it. The showcase this year was about one of my favorite wrestlers Stone Cold it included some of the most important matches in his career. I actually really like the new submission system but I did turn off the limited reversals. The roster this year is huge including legends, current superstars, and nxt superstars. When the game first came out it was full glitches and constantly crashed but now it rarely if ever crashes. If I could change one thing about the WWE 2K series is that the PC version comes out at the same time as the Console version.                9/10!

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 3, 2016
												TL;DR - You know how sometimes garbage can still be fun? Well this game is absolute garbage that can still be fun. Why are you even bothering with reviews? You have no other choice, either buy this piece of crap or give up wrestling gaming. 2K have us by the balls and they know it, exploit it and love it.Okay, first of all, let's be fair here. Recommendations are absolutely useless when it comes to the only game brand offering a solution (or at least a sad excuse for one) to us wrestling fans in the past two years. So of course I would say you should wait for the lowest price possible and get it. However, under absolutely no circumstances am I able to in good conscience mark this as â€œrecommendedâ€.True, it is awesome to finally be able to play wrestling on PC after having to make do with the holy work of Rawmodders and their constant releases of mods for the 1995 RAW game. Nice of you to remember PC exists after 20 years, 2K! The graphics are spectacular, the audio quality as well. You are able to recreate your favorite WWE moments, or create your own new ones as you choose. Very nice.Besides that? It is obvious that everything besides graphics has been given the absolute minimal possible attention, without any QA or beta testing (even though Iâ€™m sure thousands of you, just like me, would have happily done it for free). The controllers are the most atrocious I have EVER experienced in my life as a 31 year old gamer. Donâ€™t believe me? Try playing a Triple Threat or Fatal 4-Way, I dare you. An opponent could be outside the ring 70 ft. away from you, and still when you try to break the pin count the game will for some reason think you wish to kick the air in hopes of hitting said opponent (what, you aren't a Jedi?). Nothing is more fun then having one of your oponents pinning another one right under your nose while you desperately pray that hitting the required button will actually have the meant effect. "Smack your TV", huh? More like smack your keyboard. The referee also works in a 1.5-2 seconds delay regardless to your specs, meaning you only have to the count of 8-9 to get back in the ring, causing a lot of frustration and turning skills like â€œrelentless forceâ€ (extra damage outside of the ring) and the best OMG moments (like smashing you opponent through the table) irrelevant, as they WILL cause you to get counted out. In summary, you will do everything right and the less than amateur controllers will still make sure you lose. Yeah, I know, it could have been easily fixed, but why should they when so many of us will still buy the game having no alternatives? I know what you might think, I'm probably just not that good. Fair enough. As I've said, try it. Apology accepted. Now letâ€™s talk about My Career. Hooray, I get to create my own superstar with his own appearance, move set, entrance and what not! Great, right? Wrong. Why canâ€™t we use custom music or titantron movies? Because it would have taken some work. Why will 95% of your matches be regular mundane 1 on 1 regardless to occurrences? Because anything else would have actually taken some programing effort. Why will the game decide that you are a Heel after about 20 hours of game time in complete contrary to your actions thus far, and wonâ€™t let you change it even though the crowd loves you and you are a Face in all ways possible? Because taking care of bugs and actually offering customer service is beneath 2k. Try it, write to them about that bug (or any bug). I wouldn't hold my breath though.Let us continue. Oh, I see these two superstars are scheduled to be in a 1 on 1 title match on this weekendâ€™s pay per view. What would be the most realistic and logical thing to do? Wait! I got it! Letâ€™s put them in a 1 on 1 match in both programs this week, nothing draws the crowd more than watching the same â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ match three times in a row! (said no GM ever). Seriously, what dim witted never-watched-an-episode-in-my-life degenerate now lives with the shame of being responsible for this?! And another thing. Is this a game, or a cellular app pay2win? Because the SP awarded for 5 star matches make you wonder where you buy more in order to actually upgrade your superstar before WWE 2K35 is released. The amounts of useless redundant boring grinding is embarrassing, maxing-out your created superstar should be challenging, not invoke suicidal thoughts. Many say this yearâ€™s My Career is a lot better than last yearâ€™s, to which I say hogwash. Last year was terrible for its reasons, and this yearâ€™s terrible for itâ€™s reasons. Narrators no longer use the name you chose, the entire match is the same dialogue about your opponent (they know our move set, canâ€™t they say anything about that? What, Cole, King and JBL were too busy to record?). The highlights are complete garbage, showing every reversal done by your opponent but hardly ever your OMG moments or hard grapples. Also, remember how last year we got extra SP for being in the pay per view? Well now your superstar is in every single pay per view without getting squat. Keep grinding, donâ€™t worry about getting bored, the extra sophisticated game engine will make sure to give you the same match over and over and over (and over) again. How exciting! And of course, the reversal engine! Nothing could have been more terrible, I have no idea what bunch of 5 year olds decided on that system. I get it, they had to do something, but this? Disgusting. Last year you simply had to hit F at the exact micro-second, as your opponent dominates you while you attempt to figure out how. Now superstars have a limited number of reversals (which get replenished according to your Reversal stat, just as long as your opponent's get replenished faster). Not to mention the system is buggy as hell, and your opponent WILL use magically conjured reversals without them being removed from his current reversal counter. Why? Because f*** you, thatâ€™s why. In addition, you can create a superheavyweight and he will still be tossed around and dropped by the tiniest of wrestlers. Makes perfect sense, right? Just like the fact that every time you are down on the floor outside the ring ANY AND ALL opponents will run to the ring and wait for you to be counted out (as you helplessly push the button to enter the ring, which only works on occasion). Just the way John Cena and The Undertaker like to win matches, right? Let the other guy get counted out! Superstars donâ€™t drag the opponent back to the ring on RAW and Smackdown in order to beat them honorably, right? Right.Forgive me, but Iâ€™m tired of this. I am furious with myself for actually spending money on this piece of garbage instead of getting a torrent. Iâ€™m disgusted by every cent 2K has made for this half-a**ed work, exploiting their monopoly. The game is quite fun at times, until one of the infinite number of problems occur and make you want to smash your keyboard through the jaw of whoeverâ€™s in charge of those 2K idiots. I donâ€™t know, wait till the end of the year when Humble Bundle offers this game and 10 others for like 15$. Iâ€™m at a loss for other solutions.

content:
Posted: September 3, 2016
												After seeing and playing WWE 2k14 on xbox 360 which was quiet some time ago, I see that 2k is a really promising company when it comes to games. NBA 2k11 is the best sports game ever created and the whole Nba2k series as a whole is the best sports series ever created, NBA2k16 is also an amazing game. WWE2k14 was the best wrestling game I had played ever since Here comes the pain, for the first time 100 custom supestar slots and everything just improved.2k15 was a dissapointment but here is 2k16. The first thing I noticed playing this game is that the graphics are amazing, a really good looking game and the crowds are really realistic except when they are throwing their arms around like idiots but it just puts in some anticipation in the game. The gameplay is really good and is way better, they really improved it and it feels like Here comes the pain, fast and responsive. But the issues with 2k16 comes to the online modes because 2k doesn't seem to give aâ™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥about the servers especially the PC versions of 2k games like NBA as well I'm expericing slow load times on the internet modes. For me my main focus on a wwe wrestling game is the customization because you will never be able to have Barrack Obama fight Chuck Norris while Snoop dogg inturups out of nowhere.Unfortantley the customization is limited, a lot of the clothing features are gone in create a wrestler and that to me is like getting a piece of chocolate cake and someome takes a knife, cuts it in half and tells you to â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ yourself. Why did they get rid of so many clothing features? it's very limited. Other than the apperance options, the editing of the face and everything about the wrestler is very enhanced and powerful. I also like the photo scanner, using a photo to make a person is the best way to go and even players of The sims 2 can agree on this. The photo scanner has led to many accurate creations.The community creations centre is â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ed at the moment because 2K doesn't seem to care about it's online modes, for some reason in this game we have to search via hashtags which is just dumb, you get three hash tag slots to search I mean what the â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ just search normally what's the point. But the community creations search feautre is broken beyond belief. I tried searching for the hashtag Tupac Shakur and it didn't give me anything related to Tupac, I tried another search for Bruce Lee and still nothing relevant to Bruce Lee. If 2k17 is like this then we will have a big problem.Something I also realized is that the comunity creations is just small overall, 2k needs to consider merging the creations on PS4 Xbox one and PC into one because I've watched youtube videos of really impressive creations only to be dissapointed because they aren't for PC. What a dam shame. Another feature that needs to be added is inter-gender matches which have been absent since Smackdown vs Raw 2007. Without inter-gender matches the diva's are pointless, this is also another issue that happened with FIFA 16, you can't have Barcelona play against the US women's national team. Who ever is stopping the fun, â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ yourself and add it in. In The sims you can have a woman fight a man and have them insult each other and just mess each other up as a whole. Other than that, WWE2k16 is a really good game and a step forward. The gameplay is astonishing and the detail they've added in is spectacular and I can't wait to see WWE2k17EDIT: I'm realizing that the game is recieving backlash because it is "Too slow" or "I'm having performance issues" ignore these people that's pretty much BS, you get those reviews on GTA V as well becasue some people aren't checking their hardware correctley. I have an nvidia gtx 950 2 gb and I can play this and GTA V on ultra settings with no problems

content:
Posted: May 6, 2016
												and just like that my play time is over 100 hours.lets start by saying that i cant stand modern day pro wrestling.good, now that thats out of the way we can talk about the game.there is a ton of customization (i'd guess about half my play time has been spent getting everything juuuuuuust right) which opens things up nicely for people in my boat who dont know who half of these new guys are (but know the outfits and gimmicks from back in the day)lots of great classic wrestlers, but most are unlockables not available at start of game (showcase mode)where the game really shines is in the universe mode.i effectively took all the venues and people who i dont know/cant stand out of my game and replaced them with an impressive assortment of lucha underground and old ECW stars. with arenas, shows, championships, characters, rosters, rivalries, teams all tweakable, you can get the kind of experience you want no matter what it is. a good example would be my wed night "WTF Backyard Wrasslin" event where michael jackson and snoop dogg can have a tag match against scorpion and sub zero, or the easter bunny can fight bob ross untill santa comes out and attacks his rival the easter bunny.ex- http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/276220767328041211/02AFFEDF66A0AD1FEFBD1C1BAAFBE4B46F020A54/gameplay is not as on par with the excitement of the older games, but the animations are much better. the slow pace is in part due to the focus on a reversal system in order to get off the defensive and have momentum shift in your favor. while it may not be as exciting as the older styles of game (wcw on n64 comes to mind as well as the raw smackdown series) it does a great job of getting the pro wrestling pace and feel out of each matchonline is rough, at best.servers are absoluteâ™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥with disconnects and lag as a constant issue, lag really bones you on the reversals (it will say you hit the button to fast and to slow at the same time, when your input was perfect)NO LAN PLAYthat means you cant even use hamachi as a workaround to get off the garbage servers and have a private match with friendsoverall unless you are a big fan of the wwe you will not want to pay full price for this game. if you are going to be playing singleplayer or local co-op its worth it on sale. if you are going to be looking to be playing online exclusively it will feel more like work than play most days

content:
Posted: March 13, 2016
												People compare this game to WWE 2K15 a lot. Well 2K15 was garbage so I will compare this game to the last decent one, WWE 2K14.-No Custom Music-Logo system is overly complicated and public, from using a logo sizing code on a website to downloading your own images from their community creations in order to use them yourself.-Cannot setup your own title matches in universe mode.-Many people reporting crashes, especially during entrances.-Many people reporting low fps, just read through the discussions page.-SOOOOOOO many items and parts are missing from the Create-a-Wrestler, I'm talking TONS!-New disfiguration system, what I call their morphing system, has dropped the sliders and is now using a complicated image interface where you move points of the facial image to morph the face. I'm having a hard time just explaining whatever this new limited system is! Oh yeah and you have to edit the front THEN the side of the face, this includes, for example, editing the mouth under two subsections instead of one, making it far less convenient.-It takes FOREVER to launch / load, and some are even unable to get the game to load at all.-The new submission system is just weird, I haven't fully grasped it yet so I won't comment about it too much.Now to be fair, here is a few things I like about the game;-Giant roster size and they actually have more divas this time. Divas tend to get sidelined, a major failing in 2K14 imo.-Can create 100 wrestlers (that all look the same because of limited CAW, i know i know, it just bugs me!)-Much better graphics (but poor optimization for some)-Of the clothing parts they actually DO have, there is more volume and detail to them making them look more real.-You can choose a matieral such as metallic, satin, cotton, ect to give your outfits different sheens.Overall I do not recommend this game because I myself am regretting buying it. If anything, follow it and wait for 2K to address the problems many are having or just wait until it goes on sale / down in price. Its a mainstream game for a mainstream audience that cares more about graphic quality rather than content quality, action over story, stock play over customization, money over innovation. So your typical modern day corporate charged grab bag full of hot air in order to make it look full. Buyer beware!

												The only reason why this game is complemented so much is because the previous wwe game was the biggest piece of trash ever. content:
Posted: March 10, 2016
UPDATED REVIEW - 04/10Now that I invested (or wasted?) more time with this game I can give you guys a better review of WWE 2k16.The game got patched but I still CANNOT recommend it. I am still playing it though, because all I do in this game is create characters, play Royal Rumbles with said creations and I have fun simulating my WWE Universe too.Anyway, let's break it down in Pros and Cons so it's easier to get my points straight. PROS  Amazing Graphics; The roster is pretty packed with a bunch of DIFFERENT wrestlers. What I mean is - there's not many variations of the exact same character like in the previous versions. Just Steve Austin, but he's awesome so SWIG O' WATER FOR THE WORKING MAN.  MyCareer isn't a joke now. Oh wait, it still is because there's a great chance to CORRUPT YOUR DATA! I'm going to talk more about this in the CONS section; You can create your own show, your own arena, championship and of course, many characters and WOMEN (suck it, 2k15) with their own move-sets and entrances; The move-set list is excellent! It takes a while to get the hang of the game, but after some practice you're gonna tear the house apart with a large variety of movements, like Springboard attacks and OMG moments; Every DLC is available right from the bat, like it says on the thumbnail. I've seen some people asking, so I thought I should add this piece of information in this review as well just in case; You can remove the Chain Wrestling stuff by going into the Options menu and setting both Chain Wrestling bars to the lowest of the low; The AI can be challenging if you raise the difficulty bar up enough; I may be biased because Steve Austin is my favorite wrestler, but the 2k Showcase is awesome. 2k Showcase can also corrupt your file too, by the way.  CONS  Although the Create-a-Wrestler Mode is very well done, there's not many options to choose from designs, tattoos, body shapes and a couple other things that really bothers me, because in the older games we had hundreds of designs to choose from and in this one we have twenty or so.Yeah, you can download custom logos and upload some of your own, but in my opinion it should have more vanilla designs for us to choose. Also, if you use too many designs in your creation, your character gets 'infected' with some weird green particules all over his body, and you can fix that by changing his skin colour just a little bit and saving right after you change it; Importing faces can be kinda buggy too, and also weird as heck; Editing faces is weird, but that is just me. I prefer the old way with all the sliders. I have a problem making asian characters as well, but that is just me again I think, lol; The submission system can be very, very random with a controller. I had no problems playing with a keyboard, but with a controller I feel it's just luck based. Just wear down your opponent and keep doing a submission move until you get it right; Lilian Garcia can sometimes glitch up her lines and say something like - AND THE CHALLENGER, THE MONEY IN THE BANK LADDER MATCH AND THE WWE WORLD HEAVYWEIGHT CHAMPION, FROM DAVENPORT, IOWA. It kinda ruins the immersion, but it is funny when it happens; Be careful when downloading stuff from the Community Creations, because sometimes the game can simply NOT SAVE and corrupt your data;And the main reasons I cannot recommend the game right now is: FPS problems. I have a kinda outdated graphic card (Radeon R7 200 Series) but this graphic card runs any other recent game well in medium settings. However, I tried to play a 30-man Royal Rumble match with medium settings, and after a while the game started to lag a lot. I had to close the match because there was no way I could keep playing in slow motion. Some people do not have this problem with lesser graphic cards, but I and many others do, especially AMD users; The game still crashes a bit during entrances like Bray Wyatt's or Undertaker's and during at any point in MyCareer mode. This latest patch fixed a couple random crashes during entrances, but it still happens from time to time.Also, songs do not suddenly stop playing after playing the game for a while anymore; Sometimes the game decides to corrupt your data. So please, I cannot stress this enough BACKUP YOUR SAVE GAME AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE! BEFORE ANYTHING BAD HAPPENS, go to Steam\userdata\[YourID] and copy the whole 385730 folder, and I mean the WHOLE FOLDER, not just the remote stuff. After you do that, paste that save in a safe place, like your porn folder. Now if you get your files corrupted by just playing MyCareer like I did, at least you have your progress saved. If that ever happens, don't panic - Shut Steam down and go to the Steam folder. Delete the ENTIRE CORRUPTED 385730 SAVE FILE inside the Steam\userdata\[YourID]\ folder and paste the one you had saved before. Now, double-click the save you just pasted and DELETE the remotecache.vdf, so Steam Cloud doesn't eff up your save. Start Steam and start your game. Steam is going to ask you what file you want to use - choose the LOCAL FILE option. You SHOULD be good to go with this method, but sometimes Steam just doesn't upload your entire save to the Cloud. If that happens, turn off Steam Cloud. It sucks, we shouldn't care about this, but this is such a messy port that if you want to buy this crap and have fun with it, it's a sacrifice you have to make; Also, JBL sucks. The commentary is golden because JBL is just 'there', and the majority of the dialogue is between Cole and Jerry. Sometimes JBL says something like OH THERE'S THE FINISHER and that's pretty much it.Besides the obvious Cons, I can safely say that this game is great IF YOU DON'T MIND BEING EXTRA CAREFUL WITH YOUR PROGRESS. However, my love for wrestling, my patience and my graphic card doesn't overcome FPS issues. I'll keep myself from playing MyCareer, 2k Showcase and a 6-man Hell in a Cell  - or any sort of a 6-man kind of match, even though is my favorite match type to play. Royal Rumble is fine now for me, but it still lags a bit.If you have a low-end PC or an AMD graphic card - you should avoid this game for now, or at least until/if 2k releases another patch or something regarding us AMD users.TL;DR - It is a fun wrestling game, lots of stuff to do but 75% of the game can corrupt your save at any given point, and it lags quite a bit for AMD users.

number of helpful: 7 of 18 people (39%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 11, 2016
												After "playing" for 1.7 hours, i have to use my refund choice now. Even though i was looking forward to WWE 2k16 on PC.Let me dive deeper into my decision though:I still own a PS3, so i can't have the shiny Next-Gen Versions of the WWE games nowadays. Then 2K decided: "Hey, let's port our games to PC aswell". 2k15 was an ok port (FOR ME it was ok. I know alot of people hated the port and rightfully so. Thanks "Humroy" for pointing that out), but it lacked in gameplay. Then 2k16 came out on consoles and it looks like a vast improvement, which made me pre-order it in February, when they announced the PC Version.Well after a 12 hour download (yeah blaming my ISP there), i got into "playing" 2k16. Unlike others i have no performance issues, but the port is seriously lacking in stability right now. Once you start, you are greeted by a splash screen on Stone Cold Steve Austin for a few minutes, until the game decides to load (same happens when running as administrator).Then you get into a game, you look forward to butting heads with the likes of Randy Orton or John Cena, and new workers like Sami Zayn (OlÃ©!) and Finn "Don't call him Prince Devitt" Balor. And that's where it starts. During Balor's entrance i was greeted by a crash to desktop. Oh well, i said, that happens in other games aswell, let's try again. Played a match between Samoa Joe and Balor. No crash this time.Then it was time to start up MyCareer which got alot of praise for the improvements over 2k15s career mode. And it looked great. I created a snobby Hollywood Heel Character, created his entrance, created his move-set.....oh wait. No i didn't. While creating the moveset, the game died twice with a "WWE2k16 is not responding anymore". At this point i said "â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ it, that's the final straw" and chose my refund option. Now some people will say: "Uggggghhhh, but it runs fine for me, maybe try this or that. Must be your system!" No, i'm done with that. All i wanted was a great PC port after 2k15s port wasn't that great. Because, hell, 2k16 deserves a great port. The improvements to the gameplay are there (except the submission system, which is straight up garbage), now work on the stability of your port.

												From what i managed to play the games is 100x better then any other WWE game so far (even without GM Mode). Sadly though as soon as i try do anything other then a 1vs1 the game goes into super slow motion and is basically unplayable. Posted: March 14, 2016
												As much as I would love to like this game, I really can't.  The counter system seems even worse than last years, which is saying something (how the â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ is it possible to counter an attack "too soon"?)  The targeting system doesn't work most of the time (I kept on trying to attack my RIVAL and the game kept on hitting my tag partner instead!)  When you start a career the game is stacked against you unless you pay to get rid of grinding (I know WWE isn't about winning but come the â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ on, I'm 60 and they're 90+!!!)  Pins never â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ing work when it's against the AI but will finish me off staight away even when EVERY bar I have is greater than theirs (I couldn't pin someone who was at NO HEALTH and NO STAMINA but he could pin me after when I had almost full health and half my stamina bar (And by he could pin me I mean the bar to hit was smaller than a gnatsâ™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥) And don't get me â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ing started on the pisspoor submission system, it makes it impossible to beat someone if the have any stamina and you aren't at max.  The graphics haven't been upgraded in several years and tyhe created characters face has holes in it (especially around the mouth area, the inside of the wrestlers mouth isn't connected to his lips)  They've added a limited number of counters in this one too, they still drain stamina as well though, so if you're opponent is spaming attacks, you'reâ™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥out of luck mate.  There are SOME possitives to the game, but they are too far and inbetween for me to even think about recommending this game to someone. The MyCareer mode is pretty good though, if not for the â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ fighting system.

content:
Posted: May 28, 2016
												- Can't have mixed matches with male and diva superstars cause PG era- Can't import your own music- Game still has corruptions - No diverse voice acting like old Raw vs Smackdown games for your own superstar, you have one generic voice. Deal with it.- Can't even play as a superstar for story, you HAVE to be a male CAW with one voice cause budget cuts.- Countering and kicking out a pin fall is all a quicktime event mini game. I'm "too early" to dodge that chair about to cripple my legs? WHAT?!- Can't even create your own storyline like in 2k12. I don't care if its text only, why can't you let me have my own fun? Oh right. This is WWE 2k16- Compared to Here comes the pain and Raw vs Smackdown 2006-2009's storyline with allusions to the attitude era, the story is just so crap. I don't feel like I make an impact in the company like in the old games. Counter argument is "B-but muh-r-realisms for being a wrestler!" If I wanted to know what it's like to be rejected and constantly deal with John Cena being the poster boy and not me I would try to run for the real WWE and not play a video game.Other than that, this is the only PC Wrestling game I can play cause the other ones aren't supported anymore when it comes to online communities. I can have a bit of fun here and there since the game at least has Steve Austin and community created wrestlers (which can corrupt your save).If you haven't played any recent WWE games that are worse than this since you come from the old PS2 ones and stopped watching wrestling ever since, you won't recognize most of the roster and will realize how bad WWE is now. I can still have some fun because of custom creations and the WWE Legends to remind me of the old days.There's still more for me to unlock, hopefully unlocking everything will make the game better. I'll update the review then. Behind all of the complaints, there's a fun game waiting to be played. The combat mechanics aren't honestly all that bad but the quicktime events just kills it for me especially when "Press button within split second or lose the match" is what summarizes every match.*Update 28/05/2016* - Game won't even start now, crashes on startup. Piece of garbage, can't refund 0/10 inb4 2k17 comes out and they never fix this game

content:
Posted: March 13, 2016
												This game is a high contrast picture. It has some AWESOME game design marred by shitawful implementation that makes the experience on the whole very unenjoyable.The pros:- The graphics look quite frankly amazing even on lower settings.- The roster is humongous.- The customization options were largely improved over WWE2k15, including the inclusion of custom divas.- Career mode is fun, but...The cons:- The lnput lags. And i don't mean a bit. I mean that a game where your winning or losing a match (escaping a pin) is based on a timing minigame, has a solid half second of input delay. That is unplayable. You can still win if you get used to it, but it's terrible for a company like 2K to not even be able to code a decent input manager.- Reversals are â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ing impossible. Let's be real here: nobody knows ALL the moves to this game. There's just too many. Even if they did, they'd not be able to spot which is being done in time for the reversal window to matter. Hence why the input delay, coupled with the fact that sometimes the reversal prompts just refuse to show, or show too early/late, is again a huge problem that needs addressing ASAP. Considering i've read various sources saying it's been there since 2014, i'd not hold my breath for a fix.- The AI cheats. If you have limited reversals enabled (Don't) the AI will ignore that if you're gaining too much on it. It also kicks out after the second or third finisher in a match. And we're not talking Undertaker versus Sting on PPV here, we're talking jobbers on a normal show night.- Lip synching in the very few dubbed scenes is comedically bad, but nobody gives aâ™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥about that.In summation: The game designers for this game put a lot of effort into building a simulator. The fact that the match is graded on its entertainment value is an awesome idea that makes losing feel like less of a failure, if you at least managed to get a good rating out of the match, the strategic choices when building a moveset and stats combination are as deep as it gets, then whoever programmed the whole thing took a giant steamingâ™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥all over the very obvious effort and ruined it with â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ AI and Input.Good job 2K.

content:
Posted: March 11, 2016
												IF you have a hardcore gaming rig and can get this game running to a playable level, you will be met with slow paced gameplay that will entice any Randy Orton VS. John Cena fan. Assuming you can actually have the audience turned on, they are way better than ever before. The creation suite is best suited for fans of American wrestling that want to make all their favorite WWE/WCW wrestlers with the face photo feature. The mask choice is extremely limited, so luchadores and other masked favorites are out of the question. They included the horns for Jyushin Thunder Liger, but left out his mask design. You can forget about WWF/E honoree Tiger Mask, his ears and fur are left out as well.But hey, you can probably get Lilian Garcia to say your name. That's cool right?....right?All the problems from PS4 and XBone are still here, it just runs way worse. You get the newest and hottest hardware, and I'm sure you can make it work the way it was meant to on PC...with 30fps entrances...1/10, would rather get my refund than play again on a mega rig.

number of helpful: 7 of 34 people (21%) found this review helpful3 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 10, 2016
												A massive word of warning if you're interested in creation. Though I've long stopped watching wrestling, I've always had a soft spot for the games. In particular, the creating of wrestlers has always been a rather large attraction and major selling point. However, despite 2K16 having a seemingly very robust creator wrestler, it is let down by one, fatal flaw. You can no longer import or have any sort of custom soundtrack. The music that is already in the game is what you have to use.Let me repeat that. YOU. CANNOT. HAVE. CUSTOM. ENTRANCE. THEMES.If you wanted to try and create Alex Wright and have him come out with his WCW theme, forget about it. Wanted to create a character from another game and have them walk out to their theme, nope. Frankly, this is disgraceful and removes a large element of fun from the game. It might seem like a silly thing to rage about, but I'd wager for a fair few people, this is a big turnoff. Honestly, had I known this, I would have never, EVER, bought the game. Sadly, I can't even refund it. So I can only look on in sour malcontent as this piece of software squats on my hard drive. Hopefully, some kind soul will create a mod which enable this a critical feature. And the fact I even had to type that sentence is rather obnoxious.Shame on you, 2K. Shame on you!  *Extended*This is my first wrestling game since 2K14. I had no idea they'd removed this feature from 2K15, as I avoided that game given all the negative reports. Again, it seems like a silly thing to gripe about, but once you've had the option to have a creation walk out to a certain type of song (be it serious or silly) you don't want to go back. It just help establish an identity for your creation.I mean, honestly, if I can't have wrestlers walking out looking all serious and moody to the Pokemon tv theme - what is the point? No long can I have Nintendo vs. Capcom vs. Sega vs. Sony wrestling abominations walking out to their respective themes - le sigh -I'm sure the game play and mechanics are fine once you've got used to them. But unless they're a return or a massive improvement on the wrestling games from the N64 (No Mercy, Revenge, 2000) then I don't have too much interest in playing the actual game - expect for drunken throwdowns with friends (again, where the entrance's are a major part of the fun). No, the creation options are what I'm interested in these days and though I'm disappointed that there is no create a story, I can still create a fictional promotion and characters and mess around every now and then (See above). This isn't a serious game for me, I have no interest in the Online. This is purely for me and my friends. The purpose of this review is for people who are in the same boat as me. If the tools are released for modding (as I'm sure they will be) then by all means, come and have another look and then judge for yourself. Until such a time, however, beware.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 11, 2016
												Assuming you have the same issues as me, once you get the optimisation/launch issues sorted (yes, not ideal - took me about 45 mins) the game runs really well.When you get into it, it's great fun.Positive:- Limited reversals: brilliant idea- Roster size: *huge*- Match types: lots- Moves: lots- Create a...: extremely in-depth. Haven't explored it much yet, but it looks good- New Day: just because New Day ROCKS.- You can beat up Nikki Bella with a sledgehammer.- Sami Zayn and Kevin Owens are pretty much spot on (they're the first match I played - Sami's entrance is brilliant)Negative:- No four horsewomen: Yes, another person saying it. The three women in the triple threat at 'Mania, and the NXT women's champion aren't included, and won't be included. Community creations may well cover it - but they shouldn't have to. WWE should be embarrassed about this.- Some things are a little outdated. Paige is the NXT women's champion, for example. But I guess, with no Bayley... and Emma isn't Evil Emma.- Amore and Cassady are included, but no Carmella. Same applies to Blake and Murphy - no Alexa. Again, a little bit lacking, considering the depth in other areas.- I tried to play online, but it couldn't find a match. Whether that's the game's fault, or just that no one's online, I don't know. But I couldn't play against anyone. So I have to give it a negative mark.I'll update it if I see anything else of interest, or if I manage to get any online games working - but overall, this is a MASSIVE improvement on 2k15, and while Â£34.99 (or equivalent) is expensive, if you like WWE, and can get it cheaper, it really is a must buy.See you all in game - hopefully!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 11, 2016
												Lightyears above 2K15.  There are only a few of the characters this time around that look like muppets, which is a good thing.  Lex Luger looks... like he was carved out of foam rubber and someone is working his mouth hole with a hand slid up to the elbow.The only thing I dislike is the new, worse "mini-game" you have while kicking out of a pin.  It seems like you HAVE to do it, even if it's a pin off a clothesline 3 seconds into the match.  Otherwise you're Jeff Jarrett waiting for Hogan to pin you.Speaking of, Hogan's not there.  His leg drop isn't there.  Any Hulkamania isn't there.  And I'm fine with that.  For me it's not about racisim and a terrible sex tape... It's that I'm over him.  What bugs me is 5 itterations of a man who held up two title matches (Warrior) but only one version of old, wrinkly, moobie Space Mountian (Flair).  I mean give me a Clash of the Titan's version of Ric.  Give me a 90's short hair cut WCW Ric.  Give me long hair 80's Ric.  Why devote so much effort into a 3 move body builder who's blown after 5 min's, which INCLUDES the 3 min it takes to run down, shake the ropes, and get into the ring proper.Sorry, went on a tangent.  The models look excelent, the gameplay is smooth, and I can't wait to keep going on my road to Wrestlemania.  Great game, highly recommend it to folks that love wrestling.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 12, 2016
												I will start off with saying, yes, I do recommend this game. Just don't expect it to be perfect.The actual gameplay is pretty good. The career mode is hard as hell, which at first I was gettingâ™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥off but then when you win a few matches it feels really good. So I think the challenge is fair. I am not sure I like the pinning mechanic though.If your timing is bad you could get pinned 5 seconds into the match. I think to alleviate this issue they could of made the window for kicking out so big it would be hard to miss. The minigame for the submissions is also weird. I just can't seem to get it down. Those are my two biggest gripes with the actual gameplay. The voicing for your character is pretty cheesy, but thats what I expected. The career mode interviews is a nice touch, however, you can tell it wasn't polished. It's just thrown in there given the small development cycle. This could really be expanded on if they had time. I havent bought a wrestling game since n64 days and I wanted to give this a chance. Most of its pretty good but I just wish that they didn't have to be yearly and they could spend time expanding on their ideas like the interviews and such.

												So, people complaining about it not working aside. As someone who has 0 issues running or playing the game, I have one or two things that hang me up.1) I can't turn off the announcers without silencing the refferee's 10 count. The announcers have to be the worst thing in 2k16 (Which is a good thing in some ways). They're beyond annoying and most of the time their lines are lazy.2) I wish it would put you into a fued with the champion automatically upon becoming #1 contender. People seem to miss that as the qualification for a title match, and will often go months of matches without their title shot.3) I wish you could have the whole roster be present in My Career mode. Maybe enable an option disabling realism for roster? It'd be cool to have more people to fight. Unless you can and I haven't gotten that far. Otherwise, 2k16 delivers big and is easily the best thing to happen to WWE games in awhile.(GM mode pls 2k? pls?)

content:
Posted: March 12, 2016
												Alright, I'll start by addressing the glitches I've encountered. The game crashed once, for me, when I was going through my entrance. I saw some crazy youtube glitches, experienced none of those myself.Improvements I've noticed so far:                   They built on what they accomplished in 2k15. The my career mode is now more fun, you can run out on other superstars, start rivalries, they put in this little backstage interview like in NBA games, you can turn heel or face there etc. etc. I have yet to experience the FULL potential of My Career, so I'll update this still, assuming I'll get sober eventually.                  Battle Royal is now a 30 man match, which only allows you to have 6 men in ring at a time, if I'm not mistaken. So they (bots) try to quickly eliminate someone, so that a new superstar could enter, so that the game wouldn't come to a stand still, so it's still quite weird, I'll leave the judgement of that to you.                  The commentary is now better than in real life RAW.                  You can run down the ref like he's a little â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥. I mean, run into him and he falls down like... well, like I would... moving on...Problems:                    I don't like the targeting system or whatever that is... Oh god, I can't handle that thing. I suppose I'm missing something, because if it's always automated, then you're going to end up facing the wrong way or trying to punch the wrong opponent way too many times...                    And the back stage interview stuff, it's lacking, but I like the idea, since it's happening on TV too, I think it's a nice idea and it should be fleshed out. But right now, it feels quite lazy.                   Is it just me, or does the time slow down, like in the matrix, when you're trying to push someone over the top ropes? I mean it's like slow-motion activates, when I have to start pressing buttons. It doesn't happen always, but it still happens.                   Like this game, I recommend it, since it's already a lot better to me, personally, than  2k15.P.S. The framerate drop is too rare for me, I can't complain about it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 11, 2016
												The incredible presentation and amazing roster of characters are somewhat tarnished by the new game mechanics used for pinning and submissions.  Computer opponents will kick out of most pins no matter how battered and bruised they are unless you hit them with a finisher.  This can make matches a grind to build up your momentum bar often more than twice in order to win.  The new submission system is clumsily implemented and caused controller breaking frustration at first.  At least 50% of gamers seem to be having problems with this new system for submissions.  I researched online and found some helpful advice from gamers who understood how to use it successfuly, so persevere if you're having trouble with it!  Overall however the pros far outweigh the cons in my opinion.  The insanely huge roster spans decades of professional wrestling and includes a lot of exciting big names.  Improvements to the 'My Career' mode make it even more exciting and involving than before, in many ways this is the best wrestling sim ever made.  It's a huge improvement over WWE 2K15 and if you forgive the two new clumsy game mechanics you'll enjoy some of the rawest, most realistic and well paced wrestling action ever devised for a computer game.

												Flawed... but okay...After last year's WWE 2K15, I was excited but cautiously optimistic to see a larger scale game coming to the PC... and while it looks great and has similiar requirements to last years version, there are some random slow down in game play moments that occur that once they happen basically requires a game relaunch, much in the same way the black ring of death last year. The 'Benchmark' tool is pretty much useless as fudging with the settings is how to find your computer's happy zone to run things steady,Anyway... I figure a patch similiar to what was given to last years edition would solve this these minor issues.That said, the roster is all there so no waiting a few weeks for the DLC like last year, there are some control commands that don't make sense to me (the new submission circle system is frustrating as all hell), and the manager on the outside causing distractions can get a bit old before they are eventually tossed from the ringside area.

content:
Posted: April 30, 2016
PROSThe gameplay has been improved. It's more fluid and less sluggish.The roster is packed. They even threw Mikey Whipwreck in there.The 2K Showcase this year chronicles Stone Cold Steve Austin's career from WCW to ECW to the WWE.Once again, 2K Showcase tickles my nostalgia bone.Ladder matches are back.Reversals seem a bit less rage-inducing this time around.CONSMini-games. Everything turns into either a mini-game or QTE.Unreasonable limitations. For example, I can't play a six-man Elimination Chamber match unless I select the Elimination Chamber arena. Uh, why? No CM Punk or Hulk Hogan. This isn't 2K's fault however.Lack of attention to detail in ring entrances. Sometimes a wrestler makes his entrance at a certain point in the theme music (see: Kane).OMG! Moments.Although reversals are a bit less rage-inducing this time around, they're still very tedious. I recommend disabling the reversal limit they introduced for this one.I recommend this game as an upgrade to 2K15.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 12, 2016
												Well first things first...the game is gorgeous and graphically slightly better than 2K15...After almost 10 hours of continous play, no random crashes or FPS drops and no start up problems (although it may take a while for the game to open from the Stone Cold screen). The game is quite well optimized even for mid range PCs like mine. With an AMD FX 6300 and Radeon R7 265 overclocked edition and 8 gb of RAM, the game runs at smooth 60 FPS with all settings maxed out and 4x MSAA. With 8x MSAA the game runs at a constant 40+ FPS and around 50 FPS with VSync off.This year there are a lot of options related to community creations and it is extremely good. One can spend hours generating content for the community.Gameplay wise, 2K16 is much better than its predecessor. The chain wrestling and grapples are quite authentic and leads to an almost real life match momentum. However it may take some time to adapt to the new submission and kick out systems. Especially submissions are difficult to manouever but propely practiced holds can be extremey dangerous.The Offline game mods are aplenty and offline career has a little more life than last year, where your actions and allies can shape your character's persona, much like in real life.The Online mode is a big JOKE. Compared to online greats like GTA and CS:GO, 2K16 is a baby, with not more than 2000 worldwide players online and you will absolutely never get any opponents in any game types. You will just keep practising :-) 2K should really consider merging the XBOX and the PS community players with PC and upgrade thieir servers rigorously for delivering a good online experience to the players. As of now, the Online mode is already dead after 2 days of the game's release.The only thing to look forward to in 2K16 is the huge roster, improved gameplay mechanics and chain wrestling systems, a plethora of offline game modes including WWE Showcase, and tons of opputunity for the community creators to keep the artist in them busy. Do not expect Online gameplay and just be happy with the offline modes and the DLCs. Atleast they gave the DLCs. For people with random crashes and FPS drops, upgrade your GPU drivers to the latest version and also checkout some really good troubleshooting tips available online.Edit: Finally online is available at the rate of 5-8 matches per day and lots of waiting if you choose to play WWELive Normal matches and not 2K Tonight. Although it is a stupid wastage of time and most the matches disconnect due to poor connections and server drops. Out of the 20 like matches I played, atleast 6 of my opponents were replaced by AI mid way through the match due to poor connectivity.

												Was hoping to have some fun reliving my PS2 smackdown games. All this game does is test your reflexes to see if you can hit the reversal quickly enough. But if you do it too well, then you run out and can't do anymore. How's that make sense? And pray you don't get in a submission, even with an XBox 1 controller it's impossible.Health doesn't really matter, stamina doesn't really matter, hell, even specials don't really seem to matter, the match will end...eventually.Load times are unbearably long, even with an SSD.The graphics are about the same, though, so there's that.

												I really wanted to recommend this game to others & actually even with all the minor bugs/glitches such as long splash screen/loading time to even start the game, crashes during certain entrances (which I was actually able to fix with a few tweaks in Nvidia control panel) just to name a few, I was still going to recommend this game to others because after all there is bound to be some bugs/glitches with a game when initially released on a new platform & other then the few minor bugs/glitches I was having, the game itself as far as graphics etc is amazing plus the huge roster & the unbelievable community creations this year compared to last year is awesome (other then the 20 downloads per day limit which imo is just lame). But after what happened the past 2 days I can not recommend it now. First yesterday I get the error message when downloading caws that the file is damaged & can not be downloaded (This has happened since yesterday EVERY TIME I try downloading caws. On top of that now today all my save files some how are coming up as corrupt & I have lost every single 1 of my caws that I made as well as others that I had downloaded from the CC which still were working  as well as I lost my Career saved game. So basically over 140+ hours worth of progress in the game since release all gone (playing my career, Uni & uploading caws to the CC as well as downloading caws & I had to uninstall & am now reinstalling game & having to start all over again  which is complete crap! Hopefully devs will release a patch to fix the issues going on with the game (especially the corrupt save issue) & maybe then I can finally recommend this game to others but for now do not waste your money until the issues hopefully are fixed :(

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 12, 2016
												Well first things first...the game is gorgeous and graphically slightly better than 2K15...After almost 10 hours of continous play, no random crashes or FPS drops and no start up problems (although it may take a while for the game to open from the Stone Cold screen). The game is quite well optimized even for mid range PCs like mine. With an AMD FX 6300 and Radeon R7 265 overclocked edition and 8 gb of RAM, the game runs at smooth 60 FPS with all settings maxed out and 4x MSAA. With 8x MSAA the game runs at a constant 40+ FPS and around 50 FPS with VSync off.This year there are a lot of options related to community creations and it is extremely good. One can spend hours generating content for the community.Gameplay wise, 2K16 is much better than its predecessor. The chain wrestling and grapples are quite authentic and leads to an almost real life match momentum. However it may take some time to adapt to the new submission and kick out systems. Especially submissions are difficult to manouever but propely practiced holds can be extremey dangerous.The Offline game mods are aplenty and offline career has a little more life than last year, where your actions and allies can shape your character's persona, much like in real life.The Online mode is a big JOKE. Compared to online greats like GTA and CS:GO, 2K16 is a baby, with not more than 2000 worldwide players online and you will absolutely never get any opponents in any game types. You will just keep practising :-) 2K should really consider merging the XBOX and the PS community players with PC and upgrade thieir servers rigorously for delivering a good online experience to the players. As of now, the Online mode is already dead after 2 days of the game's release.The only thing to look forward to in 2K16 is the huge roster, improved gameplay mechanics and chain wrestling systems, a plethora of offline game modes including WWE Showcase, and tons of opputunity for the community creators to keep the artist in them busy. Do not expect Online gameplay and just be happy with the offline modes and the DLCs. Atleast they gave the DLCs. For people with random crashes and FPS drops, upgrade your GPU drivers to the latest version and also checkout some really good troubleshooting tips available online.Edit: Finally online is available at the rate of 5-8 matches per day and lots of waiting if you choose to play WWELive Normal matches and not 2K Tonight. Although it is a stupid wastage of time and most the matches disconnect due to poor connections and server drops. Out of the 20 like matches I played, atleast 6 of my opponents were replaced by AI mid way through the match due to poor connectivity.

PROSThe gameplay has been improved. It's more fluid and less sluggish.The roster is packed. They even threw Mikey Whipwreck in there.The 2K Showcase this year chronicles Stone Cold Steve Austin's career from WCW to ECW to the WWE.Once again, 2K Showcase tickles my nostalgia bone.Ladder matches are back.Reversals seem a bit less rage-inducing this time around.CONSMini-games. Everything turns into either a mini-game or QTE.Unreasonable limitations. For example, I can't play a six-man Elimination Chamber match unless I select the Elimination Chamber arena. Uh, why? No CM Punk or Hulk Hogan. This isn't 2K's fault however.Lack of attention to detail in ring entrances. Sometimes a wrestler makes his entrance at a certain point in the theme music (see: Kane).OMG! Moments.Although reversals are a bit less rage-inducing this time around, they're still very tedious. I recommend disabling the reversal limit they introduced for this one.I recommend this game as an upgrade to 2K15.

content:
Posted: September 2, 2016
												Overall. a much more improved game compared to the previous installments. I enjoyed the MYCAREER mode but somehow, I miss the storyline elements that make the feature more in depth and fun instead of the current one. Nonetheless, the game mode is alright.My only problems are that for the first few years in NXT, it becomes really a hassle and repetitive to keep fighting in matches that are of no significance to the storyline (for example WWE Superstars) and how tremendously long it takes to get to the main roster. For the WWE UNIVERSE mode, also known as a sandbox style mode, I enjoy making my own franchises and matchups but once again, feud storylines and cutscenes are repetitive and bringing back to old style of storyline rivalries in MYGM mode back in its glorious SvR days can make things much more interesting ( for example, make a handicap 3 on 1 rivalry with proper storyline cutscenes).Another problem I have with WWE games since WWE SvR2008. PLEASE BRING BACK GENERAL MANAGER MODE!Especially now with the roster brand split, bringing back the GM Mode will make more sense. I still remember as a kid playing SvR on my PSP and spending HOURS and HOURS on that game mode, so imagine how I felt when it got removed after SvR2008. Furthermore, with the inclusion of WWE Universe, it made customisation available which expands the possibilities of a GM mode.The showcast mode was fine, brings back memories relived in video games (which essentially is what WWE tries to bring every year), the only thing that I did not like was how oriented this mode was towards WWE Legends. I understand the previous year they included WWE Rivalries Showcase and maybe this year they want a different approach. However, we know the COUNTLESS of rivalries in WWE and some barely showcased ever (Cena vs Edge my personal fav IMO) and give them a chance as well.Overall, a great game to pick up and play. I wouldn't hesitate to pick up this game if its on 75% off but for its current price, but if u plan to buy this game at full price, hopefully, don't be disappointed with what you get.
